pada pāṭha: tvām | ūm̐ iti | te | su-ābhuvaḥ | śumbhanti | aśva-rādhasaḥ || veti | tvām | upa-secanī | vi | vaḥ | made | r̥jītiḥ | agne | ā-hutiḥ | vivakṣase ||10.21.2||

IAST: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīr iva
Griffith: The holy statutes rest by thee, as 'twere with ladles that o'erflow.
Devanāgarī: त्वे धर्माण आसते जुहूभिः सिञ्चतीरिव
pada pāṭha: tve iti | dharmāṇaḥ | āsate | juhūbhiḥ | siñcatīḥ-iva || kr̥ṣṇā | rūpāṇi | arjunā | vi | vaḥ | made | viśvāḥ | adhi | śriyaḥ | dhiṣe | vivakṣase ||10.21.3||

IAST: kṛṣṇā rūpāṇy arjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣe vivakṣase
Griffith: Black and white-gleaming colours,-at your glad carouse-all glories thou
Devanāgarī: कृष्णा रूपाण्यर्जुना वि वो मदे विश्वा अधि श्रियो धिषे विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: tve iti | dharmāṇaḥ | āsate | juhūbhiḥ | siñcatīḥ-iva || kr̥ṣṇā | rūpāṇi | arjunā | vi | vaḥ | made | viśvāḥ | adhi | śriyaḥ | dhiṣe | vivakṣase ||10.21.3||

IAST: yam agne manyase rayiṁ sahasāvann amartya
Griffith: O Agni, what thou deemest wealth, Victorious and Immortal One!
Devanāgarī: यमग्ने मन्यसे रयिं सहसावन्नमर्त्य
pada pāṭha: yam | agne | manyase | rayim | sahasā-van | amartya || tam | ā | naḥ | vāja-sātaye | vi | vaḥ | made | yajñeṣu | citram | ā | bhara | vivakṣase ||10.21.4||

IAST: tam ā no vājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citram ā bharā vivakṣase
Griffith: Bring thou to give us vigour,-at your glad carouse -splendid at sacrific
Devanāgarī: तमा नो वाजसातये वि वो मदे यज्ञेषु चित्रमा भरा विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: yam | agne | manyase | rayim | sahasā-van | amartya || tam | ā | naḥ | vāja-sātaye | vi | vaḥ | made | yajñeṣu | citram | ā | bhara | vivakṣase ||10.21.4||

IAST: agnir jāto atharvaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā
Griffith: Skilled in all lore is Agni, he whom erst Atharvan brought to life.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जातो अथर्वणा विदद्विश्वानि काव्या
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātaḥ | atharvaṇā | vidat | viśvāni | kāvyā || bhuvat | dūtaḥ | vivasvataḥ | vi | vaḥ | made | priyaḥ | yamasya | kāmyaḥ | vivakṣase ||10.21.5||

IAST: bhuvad dūto vivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase
Griffith: He was Vivasvan's envoy, at your glad carouse-the weIl-loved friend of Y
Devanāgarī: भुवद्दूतो विवस्वतो वि वो मदे प्रियो यमस्य काम्यो विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jātaḥ | atharvaṇā | vidat | viśvāni | kāvyā || bhuvat | dūtaḥ | vivasvataḥ | vi | vaḥ | made | priyaḥ | yamasya | kāmyaḥ | vivakṣase ||10.21.5||

IAST: tvāṁ yajñeṣv īḻate 'gne prayaty adhvare
Griffith: At sacrifices they adore thee, Agni, when the rite proceeds.
Devanāgarī: त्वां यज्ञेष्वीळतेऽग्ने प्रयत्यध्वरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | īḷate | agne | pra-yati | adhvare || tvam | vasūni | kāmyā | vi | vaḥ | made | viśvā | dadhāsi | dāśuṣe | vivakṣase ||10.21.6||

IAST: tvaṁ vasūni kāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase
Griffith: All fair and lovely treasures-at your glad carouse-thou givest him who o
Devanāgarī: त्वं वसूनि काम्या वि वो मदे विश्वा दधासि दाशुषे विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | īḷate | agne | pra-yati | adhvare || tvam | vasūni | kāmyā | vi | vaḥ | made | viśvā | dadhāsi | dāśuṣe | vivakṣase ||10.21.6||

IAST: tvāṁ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṁ cārum agne ni ṣedire
Griffith: Men, Agni, have established thee as welcome Priest at holy rites,
Devanāgarī: त्वां यज्ञेष्वृत्विजं चारुमग्ने नि षेदिरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | r̥tvijam | cārum | agne | ni | sedire || ghr̥ta-pratīkam | manuṣaḥ | vi | vaḥ | made | śukram | cetiṣṭham | akṣa-bhiḥ | vivakṣase ||10.21.7||

IAST: ghṛtapratīkam manuṣo vi vo made śukraṁ cetiṣṭham akṣabhir vivakṣase
Griffith: Thee whose face shines with butter,-at your glad carouse-bright, with ey
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रतीकं मनुषो वि वो मदे शुक्रं चेतिष्ठमक्षभिर्विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | r̥tvijam | cārum | agne | ni | sedire || ghr̥ta-pratīkam | manuṣaḥ | vi | vaḥ | made | śukram | cetiṣṭham | akṣa-bhiḥ | vivakṣase ||10.21.7||

IAST: agne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat
Griffith: Wide and aloft thou spreadest thee, O Agni, with tby brilliant flame.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषोरु प्रथयसे बृहत्
pada pāṭha: agne | śukreṇa | śociṣā | uru | prathayase | br̥hat || abhi-krandan | vr̥ṣa-yase | vi | vaḥ | made | garbham | dadhāsi | jāmiṣu | vivakṣase ||10.21.8||

IAST: abhikrandan vṛṣāyase vi vo made garbhaṁ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase
Griffith: A Bull art thou when bellowing,-at your glad carouse-thou dost impregn t
Devanāgarī: अभिक्रन्दन्वृषायसे वि वो मदे गर्भं दधासि जामिषु विवक्षसे
pada pāṭha: agne | śukreṇa | śociṣā | uru | prathayase | br̥hat || abhi-krandan | vr̥ṣa-yase | vi | vaḥ | made | garbham | dadhāsi | jāmiṣu | vivakṣase ||10.21.8||

IAST: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminn adya jane mitro na śrūyate
Griffith: WHERE is famed Indra heard of? With what folk is he renowned to-day as Mit
Devanāgarī: कुह श्रुत इन्द्रः कस्मिन्नद्य जने मित्रो न श्रूयते
pada pāṭha: kuha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | kasmin | adya | jane | mitraḥ | na | śrūyate || r̥ṣīṇām | vā | yaḥ | kṣaye | guhā | vā | carkr̥ṣe | girā ||10.22.1||

IAST: ṛṣīṇāṁ vā yaḥ kṣaye guhā vā carkṛṣe girā
Griffith: Who in the home of Rsis and in secret is extolled with song?
Devanāgarī: ऋषीणां वा यः क्षये गुहा वा चर्कृषे गिरा
pada pāṭha: kuha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | kasmin | adya | jane | mitraḥ | na | śrūyate || r̥ṣīṇām | vā | yaḥ | kṣaye | guhā | vā | carkr̥ṣe | girā ||10.22.1||

IAST: iha śruta indro asme adya stave vajry ṛcīṣamaḥ
Griffith: Even here is Indra famed, and among us this day the glorious Thunderer is
Devanāgarī: इह श्रुत इन्द्रो अस्मे अद्य स्तवे वज्र्यृचीषमः
pada pāṭha: iha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | asme iti | adya | stave | vajrī | r̥cīṣamaḥ || mitraḥ | na | yaḥ | janeṣu | ā | yaśaḥ | cakre | asāmi | ā ||10.22.2||

IAST: mitro na yo janeṣv ā yaśaś cakre asāmy ā
Griffith: He who like Mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.
Devanāgarī: मित्रो न यो जनेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या
pada pāṭha: iha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | asme iti | adya | stave | vajrī | r̥cīṣamaḥ || mitraḥ | na | yaḥ | janeṣu | ā | yaśaḥ | cakre | asāmi | ā ||10.22.2||

IAST: maho yas patiḥ śavaso asāmy ā maho nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ
Griffith: He who is Sovran Lord of great and perfect strength, exerter of heroic mig
Devanāgarī: महो यस्पतिः शवसो असाम्या महो नृम्णस्य तूतुजिः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | yaḥ | patiḥ | śavasaḥ | asāmi | ā | mahaḥ | nr̥mṇasya | tūtujiḥ || bhartā | vajrasya | dhr̥ṣṇoḥ | pitā | putram-iva | priyam ||10.22.3||

IAST: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putram iva priyam
Griffith: Who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.
Devanāgarī: भर्ता वज्रस्य धृष्णोः पिता पुत्रमिव प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | yaḥ | patiḥ | śavasaḥ | asāmi | ā | mahaḥ | nr̥mṇasya | tūtujiḥ || bhartā | vajrasya | dhr̥ṣṇoḥ | pitā | putram-iva | priyam ||10.22.3||

IAST: yujāno aśvā vātasya dhunī devo devasya vajrivaḥ
Griffith: Harnessing to thy car, as God, two blustering Steeds Of the Wind-God, O Th
Devanāgarī: युजानो अश्वा वातस्य धुनी देवो देवस्य वज्रिवः

IAST: syantā pathā virukmatā sṛjānaḥ stoṣy adhvanaḥ
Griffith: That speed along the shining path, thou making ways art glorified.
Devanāgarī: स्यन्ता पथा विरुक्मता सृजानः स्तोष्यध्वनः

IAST: tvaṁ tyā cid vātasyāśvāgā ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai
Griffith: Even to these dark Steeds of Wind thou of thyself hast come to ride,
Devanāgarī: त्वं त्या चिद्वातस्याश्वागा ऋज्रा त्मना वहध्यै

IAST: yayor devo na martyo yantā nakir vidāyyaḥ
Griffith: Of which no driver may be found, none, be he God or mortal man.
Devanāgarī: ययोर्देवो न मर्त्यो यन्ता नकिर्विदाय्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyā | cit | vātasya | aśvā | ā | agāḥ | r̥jrā | tmanā | vahadhyai || yayoḥ | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ | yantā | nakiḥ | vidāyyaḥ ||10.22.5||

IAST: adha gmantośanā pṛcchate vāṁ kadarthā na ā gṛham

Devanāgarī: अध ग्मन्तोशना पृच्छते वां कदर्था न आ गृहम्
pada pāṭha: adha | gmantā | uśanā | pr̥cchate | vām | kat-arthā | naḥ | ā | gr̥ham || ā | jagmathuḥ | parākāt | divaḥ | ca | gmaḥ | ca | martyam ||10.22.6||

IAST: ā jagmathuḥ parākād divaś ca gmaś ca martyam
Griffith: Why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven?
Devanāgarī: आ जग्मथुः पराकाद्दिवश्च ग्मश्च मर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: adha | gmantā | uśanā | pr̥cchate | vām | kat-arthā | naḥ | ā | gr̥ham || ā | jagmathuḥ | parākāt | divaḥ | ca | gmaḥ | ca | martyam ||10.22.6||

IAST: ā na indra pṛkṣase 'smākam brahmodyatam
Griffith: O Indra, thou shalt speak us fair: our holy prayer is offered up.
Devanāgarī: आ न इन्द्र पृक्षसेऽस्माकं ब्रह्मोद्यतम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indra | pr̥kṣase | asmākam | brahma | ut-yatam || tat | tvā | yācāmahe | avaḥ | śuṣṇam | yat | han | amānuṣam ||10.22.7||

IAST: tat tvā yācāmahe 'vaḥ śuṣṇaṁ yad dhann amānuṣam
Griffith: We pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Susna dead.
Devanāgarī: तत्त्वा याचामहेऽवः शुष्णं यद्धन्नमानुषम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indra | pr̥kṣase | asmākam | brahma | ut-yatam || tat | tvā | yācāmahe | avaḥ | śuṣṇam | yat | han | amānuṣam ||10.22.7||

IAST: akarmā dasyur abhi no amantur anyavrato amānuṣaḥ
Griffith: Around us is the Dasyu, riteless, void of sense, inhuman, keeping alien la
Devanāgarī: अकर्मा दस्युरभि नो अमन्तुरन्यव्रतो अमानुषः
pada pāṭha: akarmā | dasyuḥ | abhi | naḥ | amantuḥ | anya-vrataḥ | amānuṣaḥ || tvam | tasya | amitra-han | vadhaḥ | dāsasya | dambhaya ||10.22.8||

IAST: tvaṁ tasyāmitrahan vadhar dāsasya dambhaya
Griffith: Baffle, thou Slayer of the foe, the weapon which this Dasa wields.
Devanāgarī: त्वं तस्यामित्रहन्वधर्दासस्य दम्भय
pada pāṭha: akarmā | dasyuḥ | abhi | naḥ | amantuḥ | anya-vrataḥ | amānuṣaḥ || tvam | tasya | amitra-han | vadhaḥ | dāsasya | dambhaya ||10.22.8||

IAST: tvaṁ na indra śūra śūrair uta tvotāso barhaṇā
Griffith: Hero with Heroes, thou art ours: yea, strong are they whom thou dost help.
Devanāgarī: त्वं न इन्द्र शूर शूरैरुत त्वोतासो बर्हणा
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | śūra | śūraiḥ | uta | tvā-ūtāsaḥ | barhaṇā || puru-trā | te | vi | pūrtayaḥ | navanta | kṣoṇayaḥ | yathā ||10.22.9||

IAST: purutrā te vi pūrtayo navanta kṣoṇayo yathā
Griffith: In many a place are thy full gifts, and men, like vassals, sing thy prai
Devanāgarī: पुरुत्रा ते वि पूर्तयो नवन्त क्षोणयो यथा
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | śūra | śūraiḥ | uta | tvā-ūtāsaḥ | barhaṇā || puru-trā | te | vi | pūrtayaḥ | navanta | kṣoṇayaḥ | yathā ||10.22.9||

IAST: tvaṁ tān vṛtrahatye codayo nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ
Griffith: Urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy, brave Thunderer! in the figh
Devanāgarī: त्वं तान्वृत्रहत्ये चोदयो नॄन्कार्पाणे शूर वज्रिवः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | vr̥tra-hatye | codayaḥ | nr̥̄n | kārpāṇe | śūra | vajri-vaḥ || guhā | yadi | kavīnām | viśām | nakṣatra-śavasām ||10.22.10||

IAST: guhā yadī kavīnāṁ viśāṁ nakṣatraśavasām
Griffith: Even when hid among the tribes of Sages numerous as stars.
Devanāgarī: गुहा यदी कवीनां विशां नक्षत्रशवसाम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | vr̥tra-hatye | codayaḥ | nr̥̄n | kārpāṇe | śūra | vajri-vaḥ || guhā | yadi | kavīnām | viśām | nakṣatra-śavasām ||10.22.10||

IAST: makṣū tā ta indra dānāpnasa ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ
Griffith: Swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn, O
Devanāgarī: मक्षू ता त इन्द्र दानाप्नस आक्षाणे शूर वज्रिवः
pada pāṭha: makṣu | tā | te | indra | dāna-apnasaḥ | ākṣāṇe | śūra | vajri-vaḥ || yat | ha | śuṣṇasya | dambhayaḥ | jātam | viśvam | sayāva-bhiḥ ||10.22.11||

IAST: yad dha śuṣṇasya dambhayo jātaṁ viśvaṁ sayāvabhiḥ
Griffith: As thou with thy Companions didst destroy the whole of SuSnia's brood.
Devanāgarī: यद्ध शुष्णस्य दम्भयो जातं विश्वं सयावभिः
pada pāṭha: makṣu | tā | te | indra | dāna-apnasaḥ | ākṣāṇe | śūra | vajri-vaḥ || yat | ha | śuṣṇasya | dambhayaḥ | jātam | viśvam | sayāva-bhiḥ ||10.22.11||

IAST: mākudhryag indra śūra vasvīr asme bhūvann abhiṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Let not thine excellent assistance come to us, O Hero Indra, profitless.
Devanāgarī: माकुध्र्यगिन्द्र शूर वस्वीरस्मे भूवन्नभिष्टयः
pada pāṭha: mā | akudhryak | indra | śūra | vasvīḥ | asme iti | bhūvan | abhiṣṭayaḥ || vayam-vayam | te | āsām | sumne | syāma | vajri-vaḥ ||10.22.12||

IAST: vayaṁ-vayaṁ ta āsāṁ sumne syāma vajrivaḥ
Griffith: May we, may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours, Thunderer!
Devanāgarī: वयंवयं त आसां सुम्ने स्याम वज्रिवः
pada pāṭha: mā | akudhryak | indra | śūra | vasvīḥ | asme iti | bhūvan | abhiṣṭayaḥ || vayam-vayam | te | āsām | sumne | syāma | vajri-vaḥ ||10.22.12||

IAST: asme tā ta indra santu satyāhiṁsantīr upaspṛśaḥ
Griffith: May those soft impulses of thine, O Indra, be fruitful and innocent to us
Devanāgarī: अस्मे ता त इन्द्र सन्तु सत्याहिंसन्तीरुपस्पृशः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | tā | te | indra | santu | satyā | ahiṁsantīḥ | upa-spr̥ṣaḥ || vidyāma | yāsām | bhujaḥ | dhenūnām | na | vajri-vaḥ ||10.22.13||

IAST: vidyāma yāsām bhujo dhenūnāṁ na vajrivaḥ
Griffith: May we know these whose treasures are like those of milch-kine, Thundere
Devanāgarī: विद्याम यासां भुजो धेनूनां न वज्रिवः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | tā | te | indra | santu | satyā | ahiṁsantīḥ | upa-spr̥ṣaḥ || vidyāma | yāsām | bhujaḥ | dhenūnām | na | vajri-vaḥ ||10.22.13||

IAST: ahastā yad apadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhir vedyānām

Devanāgarī: मित्राय शिक्ष वरुणाय दाशुषे या सम्राजा मनसा न प्रयुच्छतः
pada pāṭha: mitrāya | śikṣa | varuṇāya | dāśuṣe | yā | sam-rājā | manasā | na | pra-yucchataḥ || yayoḥ | dhāma | dharmaṇā | rocate | br̥hat | yayoḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | nādhasī iti | vr̥tau ||10.65.5||

IAST: yayor dhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhad yayor ubhe rodasī nādhasī vṛtau
Griffith: Whose statute shines on high through everlasting Law, whose places of su
Devanāgarī: ययोर्धाम धर्मणा रोचते बृहद्ययोरुभे रोदसी नाधसी वृतौ
pada pāṭha: mitrāya | śikṣa | varuṇāya | dāśuṣe | yā | sam-rājā | manasā | na | pra-yucchataḥ || yayoḥ | dhāma | dharmaṇā | rocate | br̥hat | yayoḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | nādhasī iti | vr̥tau ||10.65.5||

IAST: yā gaur vartanim paryeti niṣkṛtam payo duhānā vratanīr avārataḥ
Griffith: The cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of
Devanāgarī: या गौर्वर्तनिं पर्येति निष्कृतं पयो दुहाना व्रतनीरवारतः
pada pāṭha: yā | gauḥ | vartanim | pari-eti | niḥ-kr̥tam | payaḥ | duhānā | vrata-nīḥ | avārataḥ || sā | pra-bruvāṇā | varuṇāya | dāśuṣe | devebhyaḥ | dāśat | haviṣā | vivasvate ||10.65.6||

IAST: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyo dāśad dhaviṣā vivasvate
Griffith: Speaking aloud to Varuna and the worshipper, shall with oblation serve V
Devanāgarī: सा प्रब्रुवाणा वरुणाय दाशुषे देवेभ्यो दाशद्धविषा विवस्वते
pada pāṭha: yā | gauḥ | vartanim | pari-eti | niḥ-kr̥tam | payaḥ | duhānā | vrata-nīḥ | avārataḥ || sā | pra-bruvāṇā | varuṇāya | dāśuṣe | devebhyaḥ | dāśat | haviṣā | vivasvate ||10.65.6||

IAST: divakṣaso agnijihvā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtasya yoniṁ vimṛśanta āsate
Griffith: The Gods whose tongue is Agni dwell in heaven, and sit, aiders of Law, ref
Devanāgarī: दिवक्षसो अग्निजिह्वा ऋतावृध ऋतस्य योनिं विमृशन्त आसते
pada pāṭha: divakṣasaḥ | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | r̥tasya | yonim | vi-mr̥śantaḥ | āsate || dyām | skabhitvī | apaḥ | ā | cakruḥ | ojasā | yajñam | janitvī | tanvi | ni | mamr̥juḥ ||10.65.7||

IAST: dyāṁ skabhitvy apa ā cakrur ojasā yajñaṁ janitvī tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
Griffith: They propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might, got sac
Devanāgarī: द्यां स्कभित्व्यप आ चक्रुरोजसा यज्ञं जनित्वी तन्वी नि मामृजुः
pada pāṭha: divakṣasaḥ | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | r̥tasya | yonim | vi-mr̥śantaḥ | āsate || dyām | skabhitvī | apaḥ | ā | cakruḥ | ojasā | yajñam | janitvī | tanvi | ni | mamr̥juḥ ||10.65.7||

IAST: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥ samokasā
Griffith: Born in the oldest time, the Parents dwelling round are sharers of one man
Devanāgarī: परिक्षिता पितरा पूर्वजावरी ऋतस्य योना क्षयतः समोकसा
pada pāṭha: pari-kṣitā | pitarā | pūrvajāvarī iti pūrva-jāvarī | r̥tasya | yonā | kṣayataḥ | sam-okasā || dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | varuṇāya | savrate iti sa-vrate | ghr̥ta-vat | payaḥ | mahiṣāya | pinvataḥ ||10.65.8||

IAST: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payo mahiṣāya pinvataḥ
Griffith: Bound by their common vow Dyaus, Prthivi stream forth the moisture rich
Devanāgarī: द्यावापृथिवी वरुणाय सव्रते घृतवत्पयो महिषाय पिन्वतः
pada pāṭha: pari-kṣitā | pitarā | pūrvajāvarī iti pūrva-jāvarī | r̥tasya | yonā | kṣayataḥ | sam-okasā || dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | varuṇāya | savrate iti sa-vrate | ghr̥ta-vat | payaḥ | mahiṣāya | pinvataḥ ||10.65.8||

IAST: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇendravāyū varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: Parjanya, Vata, mighty, senders of the rain, Indra and Vayu, Varuna, Mitra
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्यावाता वृषभा पुरीषिणेन्द्रवायू वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: parjanyāvātā | vr̥ṣabhā | purīṣiṇā | indravāyū iti | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || devān | ādityān | aditim | havāmahe | ye | pārthivāsaḥ | divyāsaḥ | ap-su | ye ||10.65.9||

IAST: devām̐ ādityām̐ aditiṁ havāmahe ye pārthivāso divyāso apsu ye
Griffith: We call on Aditi, Adityas, and the Gods, those who are on the earth, in
Devanāgarī: देवाँ आदित्याँ अदितिं हवामहे ये पार्थिवासो दिव्यासो अप्सु ये
pada pāṭha: parjanyāvātā | vr̥ṣabhā | purīṣiṇā | indravāyū iti | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || devān | ādityān | aditim | havāmahe | ye | pārthivāsaḥ | divyāsaḥ | ap-su | ye ||10.65.9||

IAST: tvaṣṭāraṁ vāyum ṛbhavo ya ohate daivyā hotārā uṣasaṁ svastaye
Griffith: Tvastar and Vayu, those who count as Rbhus, both celestial Hotar-priests,
Devanāgarī: त्वष्टारं वायुमृभवो य ओहते दैव्या होतारा उषसं स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: tvaṣṭāram | vāyum | r̥bhavaḥ | yaḥ | ohate | daivyā | hotārau | uṣasam | svastaye || br̥haspatim | vr̥tra-khādam | su-medhasam | indriyam | somam | dhana-sāḥ | ūm̐ iti | īmahe ||10.65.10||

IAST: bṛhaspatiṁ vṛtrakhādaṁ sumedhasam indriyaṁ somaṁ dhanasā u īmahe
Griffith: Winners of wealth, we call, and wise Brhaspati, destroyer of our foes, a
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिं वृत्रखादं सुमेधसमिन्द्रियं सोमं धनसा उ ईमहे
pada pāṭha: tvaṣṭāram | vāyum | r̥bhavaḥ | yaḥ | ohate | daivyā | hotārau | uṣasam | svastaye || br̥haspatim | vr̥tra-khādam | su-medhasam | indriyam | somam | dhana-sāḥ | ūm̐ iti | īmahe ||10.65.10||

IAST: brahma gām aśvaṁ janayanta oṣadhīr vanaspatīn pṛthivīm parvatām̐ apaḥ
Griffith: They generated prayer, the cow, the horse, the plants, the forest trees,
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्म गामश्वं जनयन्त ओषधीर्वनस्पतीन्पृथिवीं पर्वताँ अपः
pada pāṭha: brahma | gām | aśvam | janayantaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vanaspatīn | pr̥thivīm | parvatān | apaḥ || sūryam | divi | rohayantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | āryā | vratā | vi-sr̥jantaḥ | adhi | kṣami ||10.65.11||

IAST: sūryaṁ divi rohayantaḥ sudānava āryā vratā visṛjanto adhi kṣami
Griffith: These very bounteous Gods made the Sun mount to heaven, and spread the r
Devanāgarī: सूर्यं दिवि रोहयन्तः सुदानव आर्या व्रता विसृजन्तो अधि क्षमि
pada pāṭha: brahma | gām | aśvam | janayantaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vanaspatīn | pr̥thivīm | parvatān | apaḥ || sūryam | divi | rohayantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ | āryā | vratā | vi-sr̥jantaḥ | adhi | kṣami ||10.65.11||

IAST: bhujyum aṁhasaḥ pipṛtho nir aśvinā śyāvam putraṁ vadhrimatyā ajinvatam
Griffith: O Asvins, ye delivered Bhujyu from distress, ye animated Syava, Vadhrmati
Devanāgarī: भुज्युमंहसः पिपृथो निरश्विना श्यावं पुत्रं वध्रिमत्या अजिन्वतम्
pada pāṭha: bhujyum | aṁhasaḥ | pipr̥thaḥ | niḥ | aśvinā | śyāvam | putram | vadhri-matyāḥ | ajinvatam || kama-dyuvam | vi-madāya | ūhathuḥ | yuvam | viṣṇāpvam | viśvakāya | ava | sr̥jathaḥ ||10.65.12||

IAST: kamadyuvaṁ vimadāyohathur yuvaṁ viṣṇāpvaṁ viśvakāyāva sṛjathaḥ
Griffith: To Vimada ye brought his consort Kamadyu, and gave his lost Visnapu back
Devanāgarī: कमद्युवं विमदायोहथुर्युवं विष्णाप्वं विश्वकायाव सृजथः
pada pāṭha: bhujyum | aṁhasaḥ | pipr̥thaḥ | niḥ | aśvinā | śyāvam | putram | vadhri-matyāḥ | ajinvatam || kama-dyuvam | vi-madāya | ūhathuḥ | yuvam | viṣṇāpvam | viśvakāya | ava | sr̥jathaḥ ||10.65.12||

IAST: pāvīravī tanyatur ekapād ajo divo dhartā sindhur āpaḥ samudriyaḥ
Griffith: Thunder, the lightning's daughter, Aja-Ekapad, heaven's bearer, Sindhu, a
Devanāgarī: पावीरवी तन्यतुरेकपादजो दिवो धर्ता सिन्धुरापः समुद्रियः
pada pāṭha: pāvīravī | tanyatuḥ | eka-pāt | ajaḥ | divaḥ | dhartā | sindhuḥ | āpaḥ | samudriyaḥ || viśve | devāsaḥ | śr̥ṇavan | vacāṁsi | me | sarasvatī | saha | dhībhiḥ | puram-dhyā ||10.65.13||

IAST: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṁsi me sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ puraṁdhyā
Griffith: Hear all the Gods my words, Sarasvati give ear together with Purandhi an
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवासः शृणवन्वचांसि मे सरस्वती सह धीभिः पुरंध्या
pada pāṭha: pāvīravī | tanyatuḥ | eka-pāt | ajaḥ | divaḥ | dhartā | sindhuḥ | āpaḥ | samudriyaḥ || viśve | devāsaḥ | śr̥ṇavan | vacāṁsi | me | sarasvatī | saha | dhībhiḥ | puram-dhyā ||10.65.13||

IAST: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ puraṁdhyā manor yajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: With Holy Thoughts and with Purandhi may all Gods, knowing the Law immort
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवाः सह धीभिः पुरंध्या मनोर्यजत्रा अमृता ऋतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | saha | dhībhiḥ | puram-dhyā | manoḥ | yajatrāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || rāti-sācaḥ | abhi-sācaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ | svaḥ | giraḥ | brahma | su-uktam | juṣerata ||10.65.14||

IAST: rātiṣāco abhiṣācaḥ svarvidaḥ svar giro brahma sūktaṁ juṣerata
Griffith: Boon-givers, favourers, finders of light, and Heaven, with gracious love
Devanāgarī: रातिषाचो अभिषाचः स्वर्विदः स्वर्गिरो ब्रह्म सूक्तं जुषेरत
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | saha | dhībhiḥ | puram-dhyā | manoḥ | yajatrāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || rāti-sācaḥ | abhi-sācaḥ | svaḥ-vidaḥ | svaḥ | giraḥ | brahma | su-uktam | juṣerata ||10.65.14||

IAST: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhi pratasthuḥ
Griffith: Immortal Gods have I, Vasistha, lauded, Gods set on high above all other
Devanāgarī: देवान्वसिष्ठो अमृतान्ववन्दे ये विश्वा भुवनाभि प्रतस्थुः
pada pāṭha: devān | vasiṣṭhaḥ | amr̥tān | vavande | ye | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | pra-tasthuḥ || te | naḥ | rāsantām | uru-gāyam | adya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||10.65.15||

IAST: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May they this day grant us wide space and freedom: ye Gods, preserve us
Devanāgarī: ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: devān | vasiṣṭhaḥ | amr̥tān | vavande | ye | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | pra-tasthuḥ || te | naḥ | rāsantām | uru-gāyam | adya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||10.65.15||

IAST: devān huve bṛhacchravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛto adhvarasya pracetasaḥ
Griffith: I CALL the Gods of lofty glory for our weal, the makers of the light, well
Devanāgarī: देवान्हुवे बृहच्छ्रवसः स्वस्तये ज्योतिष्कृतो अध्वरस्य प्रचेतसः
pada pāṭha: devān | huve | br̥hat-śravasaḥ | svastaye | jyotiḥ-kr̥taḥ | adhvarasya | pra-cetasaḥ || ye | vavr̥dhuḥ | pra-taram | viśva-vedasaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ ||10.66.1||

IAST: ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataraṁ viśvavedasa indrajyeṣṭhāso amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Those who have waxen mightily, Masters of all wealth, Immortal, strength
Devanāgarī: ये वावृधुः प्रतरं विश्ववेदस इन्द्रज्येष्ठासो अमृता ऋतावृधः
pada pāṭha: devān | huve | br̥hat-śravasaḥ | svastaye | jyotiḥ-kr̥taḥ | adhvarasya | pra-cetasaḥ || ye | vavr̥dhuḥ | pra-taram | viśva-vedasaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ ||10.66.1||

IAST: indraprasūtā varuṇapraśiṣṭā ye sūryasya jyotiṣo bhāgam ānaśuḥ
Griffith: For the strong band of Maruts will we frame a hymn: the chiefs shall bring
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रप्रसूता वरुणप्रशिष्टा ये सूर्यस्य ज्योतिषो भागमानशुः
pada pāṭha: indra-prasūtāḥ | varuṇa-praśiṣṭāḥ | ye | sūryasya | jyotiṣaḥ | bhāgam | ānaśuḥ || marut-gaṇe | vr̥jane | manma | dhīmahi | māghone | yajñam | janayanta | sūrayaḥ ||10.66.2||

IAST: marudgaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṁ janayanta sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Who, sent by Indra and advised by Varuna, have gotten for themselves a s
Devanāgarī: मरुद्गणे वृजने मन्म धीमहि माघोने यज्ञं जनयन्त सूरयः
pada pāṭha: indra-prasūtāḥ | varuṇa-praśiṣṭāḥ | ye | sūryasya | jyotiṣaḥ | bhāgam | ānaśuḥ || marut-gaṇe | vr̥jane | manma | dhīmahi | māghone | yajñam | janayanta | sūrayaḥ ||10.66.2||

IAST: indro vasubhiḥ pari pātu no gayam ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yacchatu
Griffith: May Indra with the Vasus keep our dwelling safe, and Aditi with Adityas le
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वसुभिः परि पातु नो गयमादित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्म यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | pari | pātu | naḥ | gayam | ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu || rudraḥ | rudrebhiḥ | devaḥ | mr̥ḷayāti | naḥ | tvaṣṭā | naḥ | gnābhiḥ | suvitāya | jinvatu ||10.66.3||

IAST: rudro rudrebhir devo mṛḻayāti nas tvaṣṭā no gnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu
Griffith: May the God Rudra with the Rudras favour us, and Tvastar with the Dames
Devanāgarī: रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्देवो मृळयाति नस्त्वष्टा नो ग्नाभिः सुविताय जिन्वतु
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | pari | pātu | naḥ | gayam | ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu || rudraḥ | rudrebhiḥ | devaḥ | mr̥ḷayāti | naḥ | tvaṣṭā | naḥ | gnābhiḥ | suvitāya | jinvatu ||10.66.3||

IAST: aditir dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtam mahad indrāviṣṇū marutaḥ svar bṛhat
Griffith: Aditi, Heaven and Earth, the great eternal Law, Indra, Visnu, the Maruts,
Devanāgarī: अदितिर्द्यावापृथिवी ऋतं महदिन्द्राविष्णू मरुतः स्वर्बृहत्
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | r̥tam | mahat | indrāviṣṇū iti | marutaḥ | svaḥ | br̥hat || devān | ādityān | avase | havāmahe | vasūn | rudrān | savitāram | su-daṁsasam ||10.66.4||

IAST: devām̐ ādityām̐ avase havāmahe vasūn rudrān savitāraṁ sudaṁsasam
Griffith: We call upon Adityas, on the Gods, for help, on Vasus, Rudras, Savitar o
Devanāgarī: देवाँ आदित्याँ अवसे हवामहे वसून्रुद्रान्सवितारं सुदंससम्
pada pāṭha: aditiḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | r̥tam | mahat | indrāviṣṇū iti | marutaḥ | svaḥ | br̥hat || devān | ādityān | avase | havāmahe | vasūn | rudrān | savitāram | su-daṁsasam ||10.66.4||

IAST: sarasvān dhībhir varuṇo dhṛtavrataḥ pūṣā viṣṇur mahimā vāyur aśvinā
Griffith: With Holy Thoughts Sarasvan, firm-lawed Varuna, great Vayu, Pusan, Visnu,
Devanāgarī: सरस्वान्धीभिर्वरुणो धृतव्रतः पूषा विष्णुर्महिमा वायुरश्विना
pada pāṭha: sarasvān | dhībhiḥ | varuṇaḥ | dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | pūṣā | viṣṇuḥ | mahimā | vāyuḥ | aśvinā || brahma-kr̥taḥ | amr̥tāḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | śarma | naḥ | yaṁsan | tri-varūtham | aṁhasaḥ ||10.66.5||

IAST: brahmakṛto amṛtā viśvavedasaḥ śarma no yaṁsan trivarūtham aṁhasaḥ

pada pāṭha: navaḥ-navaḥ | bhavati | jāyamānaḥ | ahnām | ketuḥ | uṣasām | eti | agram || bhāgam | devebhyaḥ | vi | dadhāti | ā-yan | pra | candramāḥ | tirate | dīrgham | āyuḥ ||10.85.19||

pada pāṭha: su-kiṁśukam | śalmalim | viśva-rūpam | hiraṇya-varṇam | su-vr̥tam | su-cakram || ā | roha | sūrye | amr̥tasya | lokam | syonam | patye | vahatum | kr̥ṇuṣva ||10.85.20||

IAST: ud īrṣvātaḥ pativatī hy eṣā viśvāvasuṁ namasā gīrbhir īḻe

pada pāṭha: ut | īrṣva | ataḥ | viśvavaso iti viśva-vaso | namasā | īḷāmahe | tvā || anyām | iccha | pra-pharvyam | sam | jāyām | patyā | sr̥ja ||10.85.22||

IAST: anyām iccha prapharvyaṁ saṁ jāyām patyā sṛja
Griffith: Seek thou another willing maid, and with her husband leave the bride.
Devanāgarī: अन्यामिच्छ प्रफर्व्यं सं जायां पत्या सृज
pada pāṭha: ut | īrṣva | ataḥ | viśvavaso iti viśva-vaso | namasā | īḷāmahe | tvā || anyām | iccha | pra-pharvyam | sam | jāyām | patyā | sr̥ja ||10.85.22||

IAST: anṛkṣarā ṛjavaḥ santu panthā yebhiḥ sakhāyo yanti no vareyam
Griffith: Straight in direction be the path:s, and thornless, whereon our fellows t

Griffith: Let Aryaman and Bhaga lead us: perfect, O Gods, the union of the wife an

pada pāṭha: anr̥kṣarāḥ | r̥javaḥ | santu | panthāḥ | yebhiḥ | sakhāyaḥ | yanti | naḥ | vare-yam || sam | aryamā | sam | bhagaḥ | naḥ | ninīyāt | sam | jāḥpatyam | su-yamam | astu | devāḥ ||10.85.23||

IAST: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitā suśevaḥ
Griffith: Now from the noose of Varuna I free thee, wherewith Most Blessed Savitar
Devanāgarī: प्र त्वा मुञ्चामि वरुणस्य पाशाद्येन त्वाबध्नात्सविता सुशेवः

Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य योनौ सुकृतस्य लोकेऽरिष्टां त्वा सह पत्या दधामि
pada pāṭha: pra | tvā | muñcāmi | varuṇasya | pāśāt | yena | tvā | abadhnāt | savitā | su-śevaḥ || r̥tasya | yonau | su-kr̥tasya | loke | ariṣṭām | tvā | saha | patyā | dadhāmi ||10.85.24||

IAST: preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ subaddhām amutas karam
Griffith: Hence, and not thence, I send these free. I make thee softly fettered the

IAST: yatheyam indra mīḍhvaḥ suputrā subhagāsati
Griffith: That, Bounteous Indra, she may live blest in her fortune and her sons.

pada pāṭha: pra | itaḥ | muñcāmi | na | amutaḥ | su-baddhām | amutaḥ | karam || yathā | iyam | indra | mīḍhvaḥ | su-putrā | su-bhagā | asati ||10.85.25||

Griffith: Let Pusan take thy hand and hence conduct thee; may the two Asvins on the

pada pāṭha: nīla-lohitam | bhavati | kr̥tyā | āsaktiḥ | vi | ajyate || edhante | asyāḥ | jñātayaḥ | patiḥ | bandheṣu | badhyate ||10.85.28||

Griffith: Wish her prosperity, and then return unto your homes again.

pada pāṭha: su-maṅgalīḥ | iyam | vadhūḥ | imām | sam-eta | paśyata || saubhāgyam | asyai | dattvāya | atha | astam | vi | parā | itana ||10.85.33||

pada pāṭha: tr̥ṣṭam | etat | kaṭukam | etat | apāṣṭha-vat | viṣa-vat | na | etat | attave || sūryām | yaḥ | brahmā | vidyāt | saḥ | it | vādhū-yam | arhati ||10.85.34||

Griffith: Gods, Aryaman, Bhaga, Savitar, Purandhi, have given thee to be my househ

Griffith: Her who shall twine her loving arms about me, and welcome all my love an

pada pāṭha: tām | pūṣan | śiva-tamām | ā | īrayasva | yasyām | bījam | manuṣyāḥ | vapanti || yā | naḥ | ūrū iti | uśatī | vi-śrayāte | yasyām | uśantaḥ | pra-harāma | śepam ||10.85.37||

IAST: tubhyam agre pary avahan sūryāṁ vahatunā saha
Griffith: For thee, with bridal train, they, first, escorted Surya to her home.

Devanāgarī: नाब्रह्मा यज्ञ ऋधग्जोषति त्वे
pada pāṭha: ava | naḥ | vr̥jinā | śiśīhi | r̥cā | vanema | anr̥caḥ || na | abrahmā | yajñaḥ | r̥dhak | joṣati | tve iti ||10.105.8||

IAST: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūd yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman
Griffith: When threefold flame burns high for thee, to rest on poles of sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वा यत्ते त्रेतिनी भूद्यज्ञस्य धूर्षु सद्मन्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvā | yat | te | tretinī | bhūt | yajñasya | dhūḥ-su | sadman || sa-jūḥ | nāvam | sva-yaśasam | sacā | āyoḥ ||10.105.9||

IAST: sajūr nāvaṁ svayaśasaṁ sacāyoḥ
Griffith: Thou with the living joyest in the self-bright Ship.
Devanāgarī: सजूर्नावं स्वयशसं सचायोः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvā | yat | te | tretinī | bhūt | yajñasya | dhūḥ-su | sadman || sa-jūḥ | nāvam | sva-yaśasam | sacā | āyoḥ ||10.105.9||

IAST: śriye te pṛśnir upasecanī bhūc chriye darvir arepāḥ
Griffith: Thy glory was the speckled cup, thy glory was the flawless scoop.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये ते पृश्निरुपसेचनी भूच्छ्रिये दर्विररेपाः
pada pāṭha: śriye | te | pr̥śniḥ | upa-secanī | bhūt | śriye | darviḥ | arepāḥ || yayā | sve | pātre | siñcase | ut ||10.105.10||

IAST: yayā sve pātre siñcasa ut
Griffith: Wherewith thou pourest into thy receptacle.
Devanāgarī: यया स्वे पात्रे सिञ्चस उत्
pada pāṭha: śriye | te | pr̥śniḥ | upa-secanī | bhūt | śriye | darviḥ | arepāḥ || yayā | sve | pātre | siñcase | ut ||10.105.10||

IAST: śataṁ vā yad asurya prati tvā sumitra itthāstaud durmitra itthāstaut
Griffith: As hundreds, O Immortal God, have sung to thee, so hath Sumitra, yea, Dur
Devanāgarī: शतं वा यदसुर्य प्रति त्वा सुमित्र इत्थास्तौद्दुर्मित्र इत्थास्तौत्
pada pāṭha: śatam | vā | yat | asurya | prati | tvā | su-mitraḥ | itthā | astaut | duḥ-mitraḥ | itthā | astaut || āvaḥ | yat | dasyu-hatye | kutsa-putram | pra | āvaḥ | yat | dasyu-hatye | kutsa-vatsam ||10.105.11||

IAST: āvo yad dasyuhatye kutsaputram prāvo yad dasyuhatye kutsavatsam
Griffith: What time thou holpest Kutsa's son, when Dasyus fell, yea, holpest Kutsa
Devanāgarī: आवो यद्दस्युहत्ये कुत्सपुत्रं प्रावो यद्दस्युहत्ये कुत्सवत्सम्
pada pāṭha: śatam | vā | yat | asurya | prati | tvā | su-mitraḥ | itthā | astaut | duḥ-mitraḥ | itthā | astaut || āvaḥ | yat | dasyu-hatye | kutsa-putram | pra | āvaḥ | yat | dasyu-hatye | kutsa-vatsam ||10.105.11||

IAST: ubhā u nūnaṁ tad id arthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyo vastrāpaseva
Griffith: THIS very thing ye Twain hold as your object: ye weave your songs as skilf
Devanāgarī: उभा उ नूनं तदिदर्थयेथे वि तन्वाथे धियो वस्त्रापसेव
pada pāṭha: ubhau | ūm̐ iti | nūnam | tat | it | arthayethe iti | vi | tanvāthe iti | dhiyaḥ | vastrā | apasā-iva || sadhrīcīnā | yātave | pra | īm | ajīgariti | sudinā-iva | pr̥kṣaḥ | ā | taṁsayethe iti ||10.106.1||

IAST: sadhrīcīnā yātave prem ajīgaḥ sudineva pṛkṣa ā taṁsayethe
Griffith: That ye may come united have I waked you: ye spread out food like days o
Devanāgarī: सध्रीचीना यातवे प्रेमजीगः सुदिनेव पृक्ष आ तंसयेथे
pada pāṭha: ubhau | ūm̐ iti | nūnam | tat | it | arthayethe iti | vi | tanvāthe iti | dhiyaḥ | vastrā | apasā-iva || sadhrīcīnā | yātave | pra | īm | ajīgariti | sudinā-iva | pr̥kṣaḥ | ā | taṁsayethe iti ||10.106.1||

IAST: uṣṭāreva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogeva śvātryā śāsur ethaḥ
Griffith: Like two plough-bulls ye move along in traces, and seek like eager guests
Devanāgarī: उष्टारेव फर्वरेषु श्रयेथे प्रायोगेव श्वात्र्या शासुरेथः
pada pāṭha: uṣṭārā-iva | pharvareṣu | śrayethe iti | prāyogā-iva | śvātryā | śāsuḥ | ā | ithaḥ || dūtā-iva | hi | sthaḥ | yaśasā | janeṣu | mā | apa | sthātam | mahiṣā-iva | ava-pānāt ||10.106.2||

IAST: dūteva hi ṣṭho yaśasā janeṣu māpa sthātam mahiṣevāvapānāt
Griffith: Ye are like glorious envoys mid the people: like bulls, approach the pla
Devanāgarī: दूतेव हि ष्ठो यशसा जनेषु माप स्थातं महिषेवावपानात्
pada pāṭha: uṣṭārā-iva | pharvareṣu | śrayethe iti | prāyogā-iva | śvātryā | śāsuḥ | ā | ithaḥ || dūtā-iva | hi | sthaḥ | yaśasā | janeṣu | mā | apa | sthātam | mahiṣā-iva | ava-pānāt ||10.106.2||

IAST: sākaṁyujā śakunasyeva pakṣā paśveva citrā yajur ā gamiṣṭam
Griffith: Like the two pinions of a bird, connected, like two choice animals, ye hav
Devanāgarī: साकंयुजा शकुनस्येव पक्षा पश्वेव चित्रा यजुरा गमिष्टम्
pada pāṭha: sākam-yujā | śakunasya-iva | pakṣā | paśvā-iva | citrā | yajuḥ | ā | gamiṣṭam || agniḥ-iva | deva-yoḥ | dīdi-vāṁsā | parijmānā-iva | yajathaḥ | puru-trā ||10.106.3||

IAST: agnir iva devayor dīdivāṁsā parijmāneva yajathaḥ purutrā
Griffith: Bright as the fire the votary hath kindled, ye sacrifice in many a spot
Devanāgarī: अग्निरिव देवयोर्दीदिवांसा परिज्मानेव यजथः पुरुत्रा
pada pāṭha: sākam-yujā | śakunasya-iva | pakṣā | paśvā-iva | citrā | yajuḥ | ā | gamiṣṭam || agniḥ-iva | deva-yoḥ | dīdi-vāṁsā | parijmānā-iva | yajathaḥ | puru-trā ||10.106.3||

IAST: āpī vo asme pitareva putrogreva rucā nṛpatīva turyai
Griffith: Ye are our kinsmen, like two sons, two fathers, strong in your splendour a
Devanāgarī: आपी वो अस्मे पितरेव पुत्रोग्रेव रुचा नृपतीव तुर्यै
pada pāṭha: āpī iti | vaḥ | asme iti | pitarā-iva | putrā | ugrā-iva | rucā | nr̥patī iveti nr̥patī-iva | turyai || iryā-iva | puṣṭyai | kiraṇā-iva | bhujyai | śruṣṭīvānā-iva | havam | ā | gamiṣṭam ||10.106.4||

IAST: iryeva puṣṭyai kiraṇeva bhujyai śruṣṭīvāneva havam ā gamiṣṭam
Griffith: Like rays for our enjoyment, Lords to feed us, ye, like quick bearers, h
Devanāgarī: इर्येव पुष्ट्यै किरणेव भुज्यै श्रुष्टीवानेव हवमा गमिष्टम्
pada pāṭha: āpī iti | vaḥ | asme iti | pitarā-iva | putrā | ugrā-iva | rucā | nr̥patī iveti nr̥patī-iva | turyai || iryā-iva | puṣṭyai | kiraṇā-iva | bhujyai | śruṣṭīvānā-iva | havam | ā | gamiṣṭam ||10.106.4||

IAST: vaṁsageva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitreva ṛtā śatarā śātapantā
Griffith: You are like two pleasantly moving well-fed (hills) like Mitra and Varuna, the two bestowers of felicity, veracious, possessors of infinite wealth,
Devanāgarī: वंसगेव पूषर्या शिम्बाता मित्रेव ऋता शतरा शातपन्ता
pada pāṭha: vaṁsagā-iva | pūṣaryā | śimbātā | mitrā-iva | r̥tā | śatarā | śātapantā || vājā-iva | uccā | vayasā | gharmye-sthā | meṣā-iva | iṣā | saparyā | purīṣā ||10.106.5||

IAST: vājevoccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣeveṣā saparyā purīṣā
Griffith: happy, like two horses plump with fodder, abiding in the firmament, like two rams (are you) to be nourished with sacrificial food, to be cherished (with oblations).
Devanāgarī: वाजेवोच्चा वयसा घर्म्येष्ठा मेषेवेषा सपर्या पुरीषा
pada pāṭha: vaṁsagā-iva | pūṣaryā | śimbātā | mitrā-iva | r̥tā | śatarā | śātapantā || vājā-iva | uccā | vayasā | gharmye-sthā | meṣā-iva | iṣā | saparyā | purīṣā ||10.106.5||

IAST: sṛṇyeva jarbharī turpharītū naitośeva turpharī parpharīkā
Griffith: You are like two mad elephants bending their forequarters and smiting the foe, like the two sons of Nitosa destroying (foes),
Devanāgarī: सृण्येव जर्भरी तुर्फरीतू नैतोशेव तुर्फरी पर्फरीका
pada pāṭha: sr̥ṇyā-iva | jarbharī iti | turpharītū iti | naitośā-iva | turpharī iti | parpharīkā || udanyajā-iva | jemanā | maderū iti | tā | me | jarāyu | ajaram | marāyu ||10.106.6||

IAST: udanyajeva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyv ajaram marāyu
Griffith: and cherishing (friends); you are bright as two water-born (jewels), do you, who are victorious, (render) my decaying mortal body free from decay.
Devanāgarī: उदन्यजेव जेमना मदेरू ता मे जराय्वजरं मरायु
pada pāṭha: sr̥ṇyā-iva | jarbharī iti | turpharītū iti | naitośā-iva | turpharī iti | parpharīkā || udanyajā-iva | jemanā | maderū iti | tā | me | jarāyu | ajaram | marāyu ||10.106.6||

IAST: pajreva carcaraṁ jāram marāyu kṣadmevārtheṣu tartarītha ugrā
Griffith: Fierce (Asvins), like two powerful (heroes), you enable this moving, perishable mortal (frame) to cross over to the objects (of its destinatination) as over water,
Devanāgarī: पज्रेव चर्चरं जारं मरायु क्षद्मेवार्थेषु तर्तरीथ उग्रा
pada pāṭha: pajrā-iva | carcaram | jāram | marāyu | kṣadma-iva | artheṣu | tartarīthaḥ | ugrā || r̥bhū iti | na | āpat | kharamajrā | khara-jruḥ | vāyuḥ | na | parpharat | kṣayat | rayīṇām ||10.106.7||

IAST: ṛbhū nāpat kharamajrā kharajrur vāyur na parpharat kṣayad rayīṇām
Griffith: extremely strong, like the Rbhus, your chariot, attained its destination swift as the wind, it pervaded (everywhere), it dispensed riches.
Devanāgarī: ऋभू नापत्खरमज्रा खरज्रुर्वायुर्न पर्फरत्क्षयद्रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: pajrā-iva | carcaram | jāram | marāyu | kṣadma-iva | artheṣu | tartarīthaḥ | ugrā || r̥bhū iti | na | āpat | kharamajrā | khara-jruḥ | vāyuḥ | na | parpharat | kṣayat | rayīṇām ||10.106.7||

IAST: gharmeva madhu jaṭhare sanerū bhagevitā turpharī phārivāram
Griffith: With your bellies full of the Soma, like two saucepans, preservers of wealth, destroyers of enemies, (you are) armed with hatchets, moving like two flying (birds) with forms like the moon,
Devanāgarī: घर्मेव मधु जठरे सनेरू भगेविता तुर्फरी फारिवारम्
pada pāṭha: gharmā-iva | madhu | jaṭhare | sanerū iti | bhage-avitā | turpharī iti | phārivā | aram || patarā-iva | cacarā | candra-nirnik | manaḥ-r̥ṅgā | mananyā | na | jagmī iti ||10.106.8||

IAST: patareva cacarā candranirṇiṅ manaṛṅgā mananyā na jagmī
Griffith: Attaining success through the mind, like two laudable beings, (you are) approaching (the sacrifice).
Devanāgarī: पतरेव चचरा चन्द्रनिर्णिङ्मनऋङ्गा मनन्या न जग्मी
pada pāṭha: gharmā-iva | madhu | jaṭhare | sanerū iti | bhage-avitā | turpharī iti | phārivā | aram || patarā-iva | cacarā | candra-nirnik | manaḥ-r̥ṅgā | mananyā | na | jagmī iti ||10.106.8||

IAST: bṛhanteva gambhareṣu pratiṣṭhām pādeva gādhaṁ tarate vidāthaḥ
Griffith: Like giants, ye will find firm ground to stand on in depths, like feet for
Devanāgarī: बृहन्तेव गम्भरेषु प्रतिष्ठां पादेव गाधं तरते विदाथः
pada pāṭha: br̥hantā-iva | gambhareṣu | prati-sthām | pādā-iva | gādham | tarate | vidāthaḥ || karṇā-iva | śāsuḥ | anu | hi | smarāthaḥ | aṁśā-iva | naḥ | bhajatam | citram | apnaḥ ||10.106.9||

IAST: karṇeva śāsur anu hi smarātho 'ṁśeva no bhajataṁ citram apnaḥ
Griffith: Like cars ye will attend to him who orders: ye Two enjoy our wondrous wo
Devanāgarī: कर्णेव शासुरनु हि स्मराथोंऽशेव नो भजतं चित्रमप्नः
pada pāṭha: br̥hantā-iva | gambhareṣu | prati-sthām | pādā-iva | gādham | tarate | vidāthaḥ || karṇā-iva | śāsuḥ | anu | hi | smarāthaḥ | aṁśā-iva | naḥ | bhajatam | citram | apnaḥ ||10.106.9||

IAST: āraṅgareva madhv erayethe sāragheva gavi nīcīnabāre
Griffith: Like toiling bees ye bring to us your honey,
Devanāgarī: आरङ्गरेव मध्वेरयेथे सारघेव गवि नीचीनबारे
pada pāṭha: āraṅgarā-iva | madhu | ā | īrayethe iti | sāraghā-iva | gavi | nīcīna-bāre || kīnārā-iva | svedam | ā-sisvidānā | kṣāma-iva | ūrjā | suyavasa-at | sacethe iti ||10.106.10||

IAST: kīnāreva svedam āsiṣvidānā kṣāmevorjā sūyavasāt sacethe
Griffith: as bees into the hide that opens downward.
Devanāgarī: कीनारेव स्वेदमासिष्विदाना क्षामेवोर्जा सूयवसात्सचेथे
pada pāṭha: āraṅgarā-iva | madhu | ā | īrayethe iti | sāraghā-iva | gavi | nīcīna-bāre || kīnārā-iva | svedam | ā-sisvidānā | kṣāma-iva | ūrjā | suyavasa-at | sacethe iti ||10.106.10||

IAST: ṛdhyāma stomaṁ sanuyāma vājam ā no mantraṁ sarathehopa yātam
Griffith: May we increase the laud and gain us vigour: come to our song, ye whom on
Devanāgarī: ऋध्याम स्तोमं सनुयाम वाजमा नो मन्त्रं सरथेहोप यातम्
pada pāṭha: r̥dhyāma | stomam | sanuyāma | vājam | ā | naḥ | mantram | sa-rathā | iha | upa | yātam || yaśaḥ | na | pakvam | madhu | goṣu | antaḥ | ā | bhūta-aṁśaḥ | aśvinoḥ | kāmam | aprāḥ ||10.106.11||

IAST: yaśo na pakvam madhu goṣv antar ā bhūtāṁśo aśvinoḥ kāmam aprāḥ
Griffith: Filled be our kine with ripened meath like glory: Bhutamsa hath fulfille
Devanāgarī: यशो न पक्वं मधु गोष्वन्तरा भूतांशो अश्विनोः काममप्राः
pada pāṭha: r̥dhyāma | stomam | sanuyāma | vājam | ā | naḥ | mantram | sa-rathā | iha | upa | yātam || yaśaḥ | na | pakvam | madhu | goṣu | antaḥ | ā | bhūta-aṁśaḥ | aśvinoḥ | kāmam | aprāḥ ||10.106.11||

IAST: āvir abhūn mahi māghonam eṣāṁ viśvaṁ jīvaṁ tamaso nir amoci
Griffith: THESE men's great bounty hath been manifested, and the whole world of life
Devanāgarī: आविरभून्महि माघोनमेषां विश्वं जीवं तमसो निरमोचि
pada pāṭha: āviḥ | abhūt | mahi | māghonam | eṣām | viśvam | jīvam | tamasaḥ | niḥ | amoci || mahi | jyotiḥ | pitr̥-bhiḥ | dattam | ā | agāt | uruḥ | panthāḥ | dakṣiṇāyāḥ | adarśi ||10.107.1||

IAST: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhir dattam āgād uruḥ panthā dakṣiṇāyā adarśi
Griffith: Great light hath come, vouchsafed us by the Fathers: apparent is the spa
Devanāgarī: महि ज्योतिः पितृभिर्दत्तमागादुरुः पन्था दक्षिणाया अदर्शि
pada pāṭha: āviḥ | abhūt | mahi | māghonam | eṣām | viśvam | jīvam | tamasaḥ | niḥ | amoci || mahi | jyotiḥ | pitr̥-bhiḥ | dattam | ā | agāt | uruḥ | panthāḥ | dakṣiṇāyāḥ | adarśi ||10.107.1||

IAST: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthur ye aśvadāḥ saha te sūryeṇa
Griffith: High up in heaven abide the Guerdon-givers: they who give steeds dwell wit
Devanāgarī: उच्चा दिवि दक्षिणावन्तो अस्थुर्ये अश्वदाः सह ते सूर्येण
pada pāṭha: uccā | divi | dakṣiṇā-vantaḥ | asthuḥ | ye | aśva-dāḥ | saha | te | sūryeṇa || hiraṇya-dāḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | bhajante | vāsaḥ-dāḥ | soma | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||10.107.2||

IAST: hiraṇyadā amṛtatvam bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pra tiranta āyuḥ
Griffith: They who give gold are blest with life eternal. they who give robes prol
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यदा अमृतत्वं भजन्ते वासोदाः सोम प्र तिरन्त आयुः
pada pāṭha: uccā | divi | dakṣiṇā-vantaḥ | asthuḥ | ye | aśva-dāḥ | saha | te | sūryeṇa || hiraṇya-dāḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | bhajante | vāsaḥ-dāḥ | soma | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||10.107.2||

IAST: daivī pūrtir dakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi te pṛṇanti
Griffith: Not from the niggards-for they give not fireely-comes Meed at sacrifice, G
Devanāgarī: दैवी पूर्तिर्दक्षिणा देवयज्या न कवारिभ्यो नहि ते पृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: daivī | pūrtiḥ | dakṣiṇā | deva-yajyā | na | kava-aribhyaḥ | nahi | te | pr̥ṇanti || atha | naraḥ | prayata-dakṣiṇāsaḥ | avadya-bhiyā | bahavaḥ | pr̥ṇanti ||10.107.3||

IAST: athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso 'vadyabhiyā bahavaḥ pṛṇanti

pada pāṭha: pro iti | su | asmai | puraḥ-ratham | indrāya | śūṣam | arcata || abhīke | cit | ūm̐ iti | loka-kr̥t | sam-ge | samat-su | vr̥tra-hā | asmākam | bodhi | coditā | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.1||

IAST: tvaṁ sindhūm̐r avāsṛjo 'dharāco ahann ahim
Griffith: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth.
Devanāgarī: त्वं सिन्धूँरवासृजोऽधराचो अहन्नहिम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | sindhūn | ava | asr̥jaḥ | adharācaḥ | ahan | ahim || aśatruḥ | indra | jajñiṣe | viśvam | puṣyasi | vāryam | tam | tvā | pari | svajāmahe | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.2||

IAST: aśatrur indra jajñiṣe viśvam puṣyasi vāryaṁ taṁ tvā pari ṣvajāmahe nabhantām anyakeṣāṁ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
Griffith: Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing.
Devanāgarī: अशत्रुरिन्द्र जज्ञिषे विश्वं पुष्यसि वार्यं तं त्वा परि ष्वजामहे नभन्तामन्यकेषां ज्याका अधि धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: tvam | sindhūn | ava | asr̥jaḥ | adharācaḥ | ahan | ahim || aśatruḥ | indra | jajñiṣe | viśvam | puṣyasi | vāryam | tam | tvā | pari | svajāmahe | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.2||

IAST: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo 'ryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs.
Devanāgarī: वि षु विश्वा अरातयोऽर्यो नशन्त नो धियः
pada pāṭha: vi | su | viśvā | arātayaḥ | aryaḥ | naśanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ || astā | asi | śatrave | vadham | yaḥ | naḥ | indra | jighāṁsati | yā | te | rātiḥ | dadiḥ | vasu | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.3||

IAST: astāsi śatrave vadhaṁ yo na indra jighāṁsati yā te rātir dadir vasu nabhantām anyakeṣāṁ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
Griffith: Thy bolt thou castest, at the foe, O Indra, who would srnite us dead: th
Devanāgarī: अस्तासि शत्रवे वधं यो न इन्द्र जिघांसति या ते रातिर्ददिर्वसु नभन्तामन्यकेषां ज्याका अधि धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: vi | su | viśvā | arātayaḥ | aryaḥ | naśanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ || astā | asi | śatrave | vadham | yaḥ | naḥ | indra | jighāṁsati | yā | te | rātiḥ | dadiḥ | vasu | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.3||

IAST: yo na indrābhito jano vṛkāyur ādideśati
Griffith: The robber people round about, Indra, who watch and aim at us,-
Devanāgarī: यो न इन्द्राभितो जनो वृकायुरादिदेशति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | indra | abhitaḥ | janaḥ | vr̥ka-yuḥ | ā-dideśati || adhaḥ-padam | tam | īm | kr̥dhi | vi-bādhaḥ | asi | sasahiḥ | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.4||

IAST: adhaspadaṁ tam īṁ kṛdhi vibādho asi sāsahir nabhantām anyakeṣāṁ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
Griffith: Trample them down beneath thy foot; a conquering scatterer art thou.
Devanāgarī: अधस्पदं तमीं कृधि विबाधो असि सासहिर्नभन्तामन्यकेषां ज्याका अधि धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | indra | abhitaḥ | janaḥ | vr̥ka-yuḥ | ā-dideśati || adhaḥ-padam | tam | īm | kr̥dhi | vi-bādhaḥ | asi | sasahiḥ | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.4||

IAST: yo na indrābhidāsati sanābhir yaś ca niṣṭyaḥ
Griffith: Whoso assails us, Indra, be the man a stranger or akin,
Devanāgarī: यो न इन्द्राभिदासति सनाभिर्यश्च निष्ट्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | indra | abhi-dāsati | sa-nābhiḥ | yaḥ | ca | niṣṭyaḥ || ava | tasya | balam | tira | mahī-iva | dyauḥ | adha | tmanā | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.5||

IAST: ava tasya balaṁ tira mahīva dyaur adha tmanā nabhantām anyakeṣāṁ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
Griffith: Bring down, thyself, his strength although it be as vast as are the heav
Devanāgarī: अव तस्य बलं तिर महीव द्यौरध त्मना नभन्तामन्यकेषां ज्याका अधि धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | indra | abhi-dāsati | sa-nābhiḥ | yaḥ | ca | niṣṭyaḥ || ava | tasya | balam | tira | mahī-iva | dyauḥ | adha | tmanā | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.5||

IAST: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvam ā rabhāmahe
Griffith: Close to thy friendship do we cling, O Indra, and depend, or, thee.
Devanāgarī: वयमिन्द्र त्वायवः सखित्वमा रभामहे
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | sakhi-tvam | ā | rabhāmahe || r̥tasya | naḥ | pathā | naya | ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.6||

IAST: ṛtasya naḥ pathā nayāti viśvāni duritā nabhantām anyakeṣāṁ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
Griffith: Lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy Law.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य नः पथा नयाति विश्वानि दुरिता नभन्तामन्यकेषां ज्याका अधि धन्वसु
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | sakhi-tvam | ā | rabhāmahe || r̥tasya | naḥ | pathā | naya | ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | nabhantām | anyakeṣām | jyākāḥ | adhi | dhanva-su ||10.133.6||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ su tvam indra tāṁ śikṣa yā dohate prati varaṁ jaritre
Griffith: Do thou bestow upon us her, O Indra, who yields according to the singer's
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं सु त्वमिन्द्र तां शिक्ष या दोहते प्रति वरं जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | su | tvam | indra | tām | śikṣa | yā | dohate | prati | varam | jaritre || acchidra-ūdhnī | pīpayat | yathā | naḥ | sahasra-dhārā | payasā | mahī | gauḥ ||10.133.7||

IAST: acchidrodhnī pīpayad yathā naḥ sahasradhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
Griffith: That the great Cow may, with exhaustless udder, pouring a thousand strea
Devanāgarī: अच्छिद्रोध्नी पीपयद्यथा नः सहस्रधारा पयसा मही गौः
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | su | tvam | indra | tām | śikṣa | yā | dohate | prati | varam | jaritre || acchidra-ūdhnī | pīpayat | yathā | naḥ | sahasra-dhārā | payasā | mahī | gauḥ ||10.133.7||

IAST: ubhe yad indra rodasī āpaprāthoṣā iva
Griffith: As, like the Morning, thou hast filled, O Indra, both the earth and heaven
Devanāgarī: उभे यदिन्द्र रोदसी आपप्राथोषा इव
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | yat | indra | rodasī iti | ā-paprātha | uṣāḥ-iva || mahāntam | tvā | mahīnām | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.1||

IAST: mahāntaṁ tvā mahīnāṁ samrājaṁ carṣaṇīnāṁ devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: So as the Mighty One, great King of all the mighty world of men, the God
Devanāgarī: महान्तं त्वा महीनां सम्राजं चर्षणीनां देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | yat | indra | rodasī iti | ā-paprātha | uṣāḥ-iva || mahāntam | tvā | mahīnām | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.1||

IAST: ava sma durhaṇāyato martasya tanuhi sthiram
Griffith: Relax that mortal's stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness.
Devanāgarī: अव स्म दुर्हणायतो मर्तस्य तनुहि स्थिरम्
pada pāṭha: ava | sma | duḥ-hanāyataḥ | martasya | tanuhi | sthiram || adhaḥ-padam | tam | īm | kr̥dhi | yaḥ | asmān | ā-dideśati | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.2||

IAST: adhaspadaṁ tam īṁ kṛdhi yo asmām̐ ādideśati devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: Trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us. The Go
Devanāgarī: अधस्पदं तमीं कृधि यो अस्माँ आदिदेशति देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: ava | sma | duḥ-hanāyataḥ | martasya | tanuhi | sthiram || adhaḥ-padam | tam | īm | kr̥dhi | yaḥ | asmān | ā-dideśati | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.2||

IAST: ava tyā bṛhatīr iṣo viśvaścandrā amitrahan
Griffith: Shake down, O Slayer of the foe, those great all splendid enemies.
Devanāgarī: अव त्या बृहतीरिषो विश्वश्चन्द्रा अमित्रहन्
pada pāṭha: ava | tyāḥ | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | viśva-candrāḥ | amitra-han || śacībhiḥ | śakra | dhūnuhi | indra | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.3||

IAST: śacībhiḥ śakra dhūnuhīndra viśvābhir ūtibhir devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: With all thy powers, O Sakra, all thine helps, O Indra, shake them down:
Devanāgarī: शचीभिः शक्र धूनुहीन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: ava | tyāḥ | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | viśva-candrāḥ | amitra-han || śacībhiḥ | śakra | dhūnuhi | indra | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.3||

IAST: ava yat tvaṁ śatakratav indra viśvāni dhūnuṣe
Griffith: As thou, O Satakratu, thou, O Indrv, shakest all things down
Devanāgarī: अव यत्त्वं शतक्रतविन्द्र विश्वानि धूनुषे
pada pāṭha: ava | yat | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato | indra | viśvāni | dhūnuṣe || rayim | na | sunvate | sacā | sahasriṇībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.4||

IAST: rayiṁ na sunvate sacā sahasriṇībhir ūtibhir devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: As wealth for him who sheds the juice, with thine assistance thousandfol
Devanāgarī: रयिं न सुन्वते सचा सहस्रिणीभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: ava | yat | tvam | śatakrato iti śata-krato | indra | viśvāni | dhūnuṣe || rayim | na | sunvate | sacā | sahasriṇībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.4||

IAST: ava svedā ivābhito viṣvak patantu didyavaḥ
Griffith: Around, on every side like drops of sweat let lightning-flashes fall.
Devanāgarī: अव स्वेदा इवाभितो विष्वक्पतन्तु दिद्यवः
pada pāṭha: ava | svedāḥ-iva | abhitaḥ | viṣvak | patantu | didyavaḥ || dūrvāyāḥ-iva | tantavaḥ | vi | asmat | etu | duḥ-matiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.5||

IAST: dūrvāyā iva tantavo vy asmad etu durmatir devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: Let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of Darva grass.
Devanāgarī: दूर्वाया इव तन्तवो व्यस्मदेतु दुर्मतिर्देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: ava | svedāḥ-iva | abhitaḥ | viṣvak | patantu | didyavaḥ || dūrvāyāḥ-iva | tantavaḥ | vi | asmat | etu | duḥ-matiḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.5||

IAST: dīrghaṁ hy aṅkuśaṁ yathā śaktim bibharṣi mantumaḥ
Griffith: Thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook, great Counsellor!
Devanāgarī: दीर्घं ह्यङ्कुशं यथा शक्तिं बिभर्षि मन्तुमः
pada pāṭha: dīrgham | hi | aṅkuśam | yathā | śaktim | bibharṣi | mantu-maḥ || pūrveṇa | magha-van | padā | ajaḥ | vayām | yathā | yamaḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.6||

IAST: pūrveṇa maghavan padājo vayāṁ yathā yamo devī janitry ajījanad bhadrā janitry ajījanat
Griffith: As with his foremost foot a goat, draw down the branch, O Maghavan.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वेण मघवन्पदाजो वयां यथा यमो देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत्
pada pāṭha: dīrgham | hi | aṅkuśam | yathā | śaktim | bibharṣi | mantu-maḥ || pūrveṇa | magha-van | padā | ajaḥ | vayām | yathā | yamaḥ | devī | janitrī | ajījanat | bhadrā | janitrī | ajījanat ||10.134.6||

IAST: nakir devā minīmasi nakir ā yopayāmasi mantraśrutyaṁ carāmasi
Griffith: Never, O Gods, do we offend, nor are we ever obstinate: we walk as holy te
Devanāgarī: नकिर्देवा मिनीमसि नकिरा योपयामसि मन्त्रश्रुत्यं चरामसि
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | devāḥ | minīmasi | nakiḥ | ā | yopayāmasi | mantra-śrutyam | carāmasi || pakṣebhiḥ | api-kakṣebhiḥ | atra | abhi | sam | rabhāmahe ||10.134.7||

IAST: pakṣebhir apikakṣebhir atrābhi saṁ rabhāmahe
Griffith: Closely we clasp and cling to you, cling to your sides, beneath your arm
Devanāgarī: पक्षेभिरपिकक्षेभिरत्राभि सं रभामहे
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | devāḥ | minīmasi | nakiḥ | ā | yopayāmasi | mantra-śrutyam | carāmasi || pakṣebhiḥ | api-kakṣebhiḥ | atra | abhi | sam | rabhāmahe ||10.134.7||

IAST: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ
Griffith: IN the Tree clothed with goodly leaves where Yama drinketh with the Gods,
Devanāgarī: यस्मिन्वृक्षे सुपलाशे देवैः सम्पिबते यमः
pada pāṭha: yasmin | vr̥kṣe | su-palāśe | devaiḥ | sam-pibate | yamaḥ || atra | naḥ | viśpatiḥ | pitā | purāṇān | anu | venati ||10.135.1||

IAST: atrā no viśpatiḥ pitā purāṇām̐ anu venati
Griffith: The Father, Master of the house, tendeth with love our ancient Sires.
Devanāgarī: अत्रा नो विश्पतिः पिता पुराणाँ अनु वेनति
pada pāṭha: yasmin | vr̥kṣe | su-palāśe | devaiḥ | sam-pibate | yamaḥ || atra | naḥ | viśpatiḥ | pitā | purāṇān | anu | venati ||10.135.1||

IAST: purāṇām̐ anuvenantaṁ carantam pāpayāmuyā
Griffith: I looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old,
Devanāgarī: पुराणाँ अनुवेनन्तं चरन्तं पापयामुया
pada pāṭha: purāṇān | anu-venantam | carantam | pāpayā | amuyā || asūyan | abhi | acākaśam | tasmai | aspr̥hayam | punariti ||10.135.2||

IAST: asūyann abhy acākaśaṁ tasmā aspṛhayam punaḥ
Griffith: On him who treads that evil path, and then I yearned for this again.
Devanāgarī: असूयन्नभ्यचाकशं तस्मा अस्पृहयं पुनः
pada pāṭha: purāṇān | anu-venantam | carantam | pāpayā | amuyā || asūyan | abhi | acākaśam | tasmai | aspr̥hayam | punariti ||10.135.2||

IAST: yaṁ kumāra navaṁ ratham acakram manasākṛṇoḥ
Griffith: Thou mountest, though thou dost not see, O Child, the new and wheel-less c
Devanāgarī: यं कुमार नवं रथमचक्रं मनसाकृणोः
pada pāṭha: yam | kumāra | navam | ratham | acakram | manasā | akr̥ṇoḥ || eka-īṣam | viśvataḥ | prāñcam | apaśyan | adhi | tiṣṭhasi ||10.135.3||

IAST: ekeṣaṁ viśvataḥ prāñcam apaśyann adhi tiṣṭhasi
Griffith: Which thou hast fashioned mentally, onepoled but turning every way.
Devanāgarī: एकेषं विश्वतः प्राञ्चमपश्यन्नधि तिष्ठसि
pada pāṭha: yam | kumāra | navam | ratham | acakram | manasā | akr̥ṇoḥ || eka-īṣam | viśvataḥ | prāñcam | apaśyan | adhi | tiṣṭhasi ||10.135.3||

IAST: yaṁ kumāra prāvartayo rathaṁ viprebhyas pari
Griffith: The car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the Sages, Child!
Devanāgarī: यं कुमार प्रावर्तयो रथं विप्रेभ्यस्परि
pada pāṭha: yam | kumāra | pra | avartayaḥ | ratham | viprebhyaḥ | pari || tam | sāma | anu | pra | avartata | sam | itaḥ | nāvi | ā-hitam ||10.135.4||

IAST: taṁ sāmānu prāvartata sam ito nāvy āhitam
Griffith: This hath the Saman followed close, hence, laid together on a ship.
Devanāgarī: तं सामानु प्रावर्तत समितो नाव्याहितम्
pada pāṭha: yam | kumāra | pra | avartayaḥ | ratham | viprebhyaḥ | pari || tam | sāma | anu | pra | avartata | sam | itaḥ | nāvi | ā-hitam ||10.135.4||

IAST: kaḥ kumāram ajanayad rathaṁ ko nir avartayat
Griffith: Who was the father of the child? Who made the chariot roll away?
Devanāgarī: कः कुमारमजनयद्रथं को निरवर्तयत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | kumāram | ajanayat | ratham | kaḥ | niḥ | avartayat || kaḥ | svit | tat | adya | naḥ | brūyāt | anu-deyī | yathā | abhavat ||10.135.5||

IAST: kaḥ svit tad adya no brūyād anudeyī yathābhavat
Griffith: Who will this day declare to us how the funeral gift was made?
Devanāgarī: कः स्वित्तदद्य नो ब्रूयादनुदेयी यथाभवत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | kumāram | ajanayat | ratham | kaḥ | niḥ | avartayat || kaḥ | svit | tat | adya | naḥ | brūyāt | anu-deyī | yathā | abhavat ||10.135.5||

IAST: yathābhavad anudeyī tato agram ajāyata
Griffith: When the funeral gift was placed, straightway the point of flame appeared.
Devanāgarī: यथाभवदनुदेयी ततो अग्रमजायत
pada pāṭha: yathā | abhavat | anu-deyī | tataḥ | agram | ajāyata || purastāt | budhnaḥ | ā-tataḥ | paścāt | niḥ-ayanam | kr̥tam ||10.135.6||

IAST: purastād budhna ātataḥ paścān nirayaṇaṁ kṛtam
Griffith: A depth extended in the front: a passage out was made behind.
Devanāgarī: पुरस्ताद्बुध्न आततः पश्चान्निरयणं कृतम्
pada pāṭha: yathā | abhavat | anu-deyī | tataḥ | agram | ajāyata || purastāt | budhnaḥ | ā-tataḥ | paścāt | niḥ-ayanam | kr̥tam ||10.135.6||

IAST: idaṁ yamasya sādanaṁ devamānaṁ yad ucyate
Griffith: Here is the seat where Yama dwells, that which is called the Home of Gods:
Devanāgarī: इदं यमस्य सादनं देवमानं यदुच्यते
pada pāṭha: idam | yamasya | sadanam | deva-mānam | yat | ucyate || iyam | asya | dhamyate | nāḷīḥ | ayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ ||10.135.7||

IAST: iyam asya dhamyate nāḻīr ayaṁ gīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: Here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with songs.
Devanāgarī: इयमस्य धम्यते नाळीरयं गीर्भिः परिष्कृतः
pada pāṭha: idam | yamasya | sadanam | deva-mānam | yat | ucyate || iyam | asya | dhamyate | nāḷīḥ | ayam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | pari-kr̥taḥ ||10.135.7||

IAST: keśy agniṁ keśī viṣaṁ keśī bibharti rodasī
Griffith: HE with the long loose locks supports Agni, and moisture, heaven, and eart
Devanāgarī: केश्यग्निं केशी विषं केशी बिभर्ति रोदसी
pada pāṭha: keśī | agnim | keśī | viṣam | keśī | bibharti | rodasī iti || keśī | viśvam | svaḥ | dr̥śe | keśī | idam | jyotiḥ | ucyate ||10.136.1||

IAST: keśī viśvaṁ svar dṛśe keśīdaṁ jyotir ucyate
Griffith: He is all sky to look upon: he with long hair is called this light.
Devanāgarī: केशी विश्वं स्वर्दृशे केशीदं ज्योतिरुच्यते
pada pāṭha: keśī | agnim | keśī | viṣam | keśī | bibharti | rodasī iti || keśī | viśvam | svaḥ | dr̥śe | keśī | idam | jyotiḥ | ucyate ||10.136.1||

IAST: munayo vātaraśanāḥ piśaṅgā vasate malā
Griffith: The Munis, girdled with the wind, wear garments soiled of yellow hue.
Devanāgarī: मुनयो वातरशनाः पिशङ्गा वसते मला
pada pāṭha: munayaḥ | vāta-raśanāḥ | piśaṅgā | vasate | malā || vātasya | anu | dhrājim | yanti | yat | devāsaḥ | avikṣata ||10.136.2||

IAST: vātasyānu dhrājiṁ yanti yad devāso avikṣata
Griffith: They, following the wind's swift course go where the Gods have gone befo
Devanāgarī: वातस्यानु ध्राजिं यन्ति यद्देवासो अविक्षत
pada pāṭha: munayaḥ | vāta-raśanāḥ | piśaṅgā | vasate | malā || vātasya | anu | dhrājim | yanti | yat | devāsaḥ | avikṣata ||10.136.2||

IAST: unmaditā mauneyena vātām̐ ā tasthimā vayam
Griffith: Transported with our Munihood we have pressed on into the winds:
Devanāgarī: उन्मदिता मौनेयेन वाताँ आ तस्थिमा वयम्
pada pāṭha: ut-maditāḥ | mauneyena | vātān | ā | tasthima | vayam || śarīrā | it | asmākam | yūyam | martāsaḥ | abhi | paśyatha ||10.136.3||

IAST: śarīred asmākaṁ yūyam martāso abhi paśyatha
Griffith: You therefore, mortal men. behold our natural bodies and no more.
Devanāgarī: शरीरेदस्माकं यूयं मर्तासो अभि पश्यथ
pada pāṭha: ut-maditāḥ | mauneyena | vātān | ā | tasthima | vayam || śarīrā | it | asmākam | yūyam | martāsaḥ | abhi | paśyatha ||10.136.3||

IAST: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā rūpāvacākaśat
Griffith: The Muni, made associate in the holy work of every God,
Devanāgarī: अन्तरिक्षेण पतति विश्वा रूपावचाकशत्
pada pāṭha: antarikṣeṇa | patati | viśvā | rūpā | ava-cākaśat || muniḥ | devasya-devasya | saukr̥tyāya | sakhā | hitaḥ ||10.136.4||

IAST: munir devasya-devasya saukṛtyāya sakhā hitaḥ
Griffith: Looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.
Devanāgarī: मुनिर्देवस्यदेवस्य सौकृत्याय सखा हितः
pada pāṭha: antarikṣeṇa | patati | viśvā | rūpā | ava-cākaśat || muniḥ | devasya-devasya | saukr̥tyāya | sakhā | hitaḥ ||10.136.4||

IAST: vātasyāśvo vāyoḥ sakhātho deveṣito muniḥ
Griffith: The Steed of Vata, Vayu's friend, the Muni, by the Gods impelled,
Devanāgarī: वातस्याश्वो वायोः सखाथो देवेषितो मुनिः
pada pāṭha: vātasya | aśvaḥ | vāyoḥ | sakhā | atho iti | deva-iṣitaḥ | muniḥ || ubhau | samudrau | ā | kṣeti | yaḥ | ca | pūrvaḥ | uta | aparaḥ ||10.136.5||

IAST: ubhau samudrāv ā kṣeti yaś ca pūrva utāparaḥ
Griffith: In both the oceans hath his home, in eastern and in western sea.
Devanāgarī: उभौ समुद्रावा क्षेति यश्च पूर्व उतापरः
pada pāṭha: vātasya | aśvaḥ | vāyoḥ | sakhā | atho iti | deva-iṣitaḥ | muniḥ || ubhau | samudrau | ā | kṣeti | yaḥ | ca | pūrvaḥ | uta | aparaḥ ||10.136.5||

IAST: apsarasāṁ gandharvāṇām mṛgāṇāṁ caraṇe caran
Griffith: Treading the path of sylvan beasts, Gandharvas, and Apsarases,
Devanāgarī: अप्सरसां गन्धर्वाणां मृगाणां चरणे चरन्
pada pāṭha: apsarasām | gandharvāṇām | mr̥gāṇām | caraṇe | caran || keśī | ketasya | vidvān | sakhā | svāduḥ | madin-tamaḥ ||10.136.6||

IAST: keśī ketasya vidvān sakhā svādur madintamaḥ
Griffith: He with long locks, who knows the wish, is a sweet most delightful frien
Devanāgarī: केशी केतस्य विद्वान्सखा स्वादुर्मदिन्तमः
pada pāṭha: apsarasām | gandharvāṇām | mr̥gāṇām | caraṇe | caran || keśī | ketasya | vidvān | sakhā | svāduḥ | madin-tamaḥ ||10.136.6||

IAST: vāyur asmā upāmanthat pinaṣṭi smā kunannamā
Griffith: Vayu hath churned for him: for him he poundeth things most hard to bend,
Devanāgarī: वायुरस्मा उपामन्थत्पिनष्टि स्मा कुनन्नमा
pada pāṭha: vāyuḥ | asmai | upa | amanthat | pinaṣṭi | sma | kunannamā || keśī | viṣasya | pātreṇa | yat | rudreṇa | apibat | saha ||10.136.7||

IAST: keśī viṣasya pātreṇa yad rudreṇāpibat saha
Griffith: When he with long loose locks hath drunk, with Rudra, water from the cup
Devanāgarī: केशी विषस्य पात्रेण यद्रुद्रेणापिबत्सह
pada pāṭha: vāyuḥ | asmai | upa | amanthat | pinaṣṭi | sma | kunannamā || keśī | viṣasya | pātreṇa | yat | rudreṇa | apibat | saha ||10.136.7||

IAST: uta devā avahitaṁ devā un nayathā punaḥ
Griffith: YE Gods, raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low.
Devanāgarī: उत देवा अवहितं देवा उन्नयथा पुनः
pada pāṭha: uta | devāḥ | ava-hitam | devāḥ | ut | nayatha | punariti || uta | āgaḥ | cakruṣam | devāḥ | devāḥ | jīvayatha | punariti ||10.137.1||

IAST: utāgaś cakruṣaṁ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ
Griffith: O Gods, restore to life again the man who hatb committed sin.
Devanāgarī: उतागश्चक्रुषं देवा देवा जीवयथा पुनः
pada pāṭha: uta | devāḥ | ava-hitam | devāḥ | ut | nayatha | punariti || uta | āgaḥ | cakruṣam | devāḥ | devāḥ | jīvayatha | punariti ||10.137.1||

IAST: dvāv imau vātau vāta ā sindhor ā parāvataḥ
Griffith: Two several winds are blowing here, from Sindhu, from a distant land.
Devanāgarī: द्वाविमौ वातौ वात आ सिन्धोरा परावतः
pada pāṭha: dvau | imau | vātau | vātaḥ | ā | sindhoḥ | ā | parā-vataḥ || dakṣam | te | anyaḥ | ā | vātu | parā | anyaḥ | vātu | yat | rapaḥ ||10.137.2||

IAST: dakṣaṁ te anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ
Griffith: May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow disease away.
Devanāgarī: दक्षं ते अन्य आ वातु परान्यो वातु यद्रपः
pada pāṭha: dvau | imau | vātau | vātaḥ | ā | sindhoḥ | ā | parā-vataḥ || dakṣam | te | anyaḥ | ā | vātu | parā | anyaḥ | vātu | yat | rapaḥ ||10.137.2||

IAST: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṁ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ
Griffith: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow all disease away, thou Wind;
Devanāgarī: आ वात वाहि भेषजं वि वात वाहि यद्रपः
pada pāṭha: ā | vāta | vāhi | bheṣajam | vi | vāta | vāhi | yat | rapaḥ || tvam | hi | viśva-bheṣajaḥ | devānām | dūtaḥ | īyase ||10.137.3||

IAST: tvaṁ hi viśvabheṣajo devānāṁ dūta īyase
Griffith: For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि विश्वभेषजो देवानां दूत ईयसे
pada pāṭha: ā | vāta | vāhi | bheṣajam | vi | vāta | vāhi | yat | rapaḥ || tvam | hi | viśva-bheṣajaḥ | devānām | dūtaḥ | īyase ||10.137.3||

IAST: ā tvāgamaṁ śaṁtātibhir atho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ
Griffith: I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वागमं शंतातिभिरथो अरिष्टतातिभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | agamam | śantāti-bhiḥ | atho iti | ariṣṭatāti-bhiḥ || dakṣam | te | bhadram | ā | abhārṣam | parā | yakṣmam | suvāmi | te ||10.137.4||

IAST: dakṣaṁ te bhadram ābhārṣam parā yakṣmaṁ suvāmi te
Griffith: I bring thee blessed strength, I drive thy weakening malady away.
Devanāgarī: दक्षं ते भद्रमाभार्षं परा यक्ष्मं सुवामि ते
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | agamam | śantāti-bhiḥ | atho iti | ariṣṭatāti-bhiḥ || dakṣam | te | bhadram | ā | abhārṣam | parā | yakṣmam | suvāmi | te ||10.137.4||

IAST: trāyantām iha devās trāyatām marutāṁ gaṇaḥ
Griffith: Here let the Gods deliver him, the Maruts' band deliver him:
Devanāgarī: त्रायन्तामिह देवास्त्रायतां मरुतां गणः
pada pāṭha: trāyantām | iha | devāḥ | trāyatām | marutām | gaṇaḥ || trāyantām | viśvā | bhūtāni | yathā | ayam | arapāḥ | asat ||10.137.5||

IAST: trāyantāṁ viśvā bhūtāni yathāyam arapā asat
Griffith: All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.
Devanāgarī: त्रायन्तां विश्वा भूतानि यथायमरपा असत्
pada pāṭha: trāyantām | iha | devāḥ | trāyatām | marutām | gaṇaḥ || trāyantām | viśvā | bhūtāni | yathā | ayam | arapāḥ | asat ||10.137.5||

IAST: āpa id vā u bheṣajīr āpo amīvacātanīḥ
Griffith: The Waters have their healing power, the Waters drive disease away.
Devanāgarī: आप इद्वा उ भेषजीरापो अमीवचातनीः
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | it | vai | ūm̐ iti | bheṣajīḥ | āpaḥ | amīva-cātanīḥ || āpaḥ | sarvasya | bheṣajīḥ | tāḥ | te | kr̥ṇvantu | bheṣajam ||10.137.6||

IAST: āpaḥ sarvasya bheṣajīs tās te kṛṇvantu bheṣajam
Griffith: The Waters have a balm for all: let them make medicine for thee.
Devanāgarī: आपः सर्वस्य भेषजीस्तास्ते कृण्वन्तु भेषजम्
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | it | vai | ūm̐ iti | bheṣajīḥ | āpaḥ | amīva-cātanīḥ || āpaḥ | sarvasya | bheṣajīḥ | tāḥ | te | kr̥ṇvantu | bheṣajam ||10.137.6||

IAST: hastābhyāṁ daśaśākhābhyāṁ jihvā vācaḥ purogavī
Griffith: The tongue that leads the voice precedes. Then with our ten-fold branching
Devanāgarī: हस्ताभ्यां दशशाखाभ्यां जिह्वा वाचः पुरोगवी
pada pāṭha: hastābhyām | daśa-śākhābhyām | jihvā | vācaḥ | puraḥ-gavī || anāmayitnu-bhyām | tvā | tābhyām | tvā | upa | spr̥śāmasi ||10.137.7||

IAST: anāmayitnubhyāṁ tvā tābhyāṁ tvopa spṛśāmasi
Griffith: With these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.
Devanāgarī: अनामयित्नुभ्यां त्वा ताभ्यां त्वोप स्पृशामसि
pada pāṭha: hastābhyām | daśa-śākhābhyām | jihvā | vācaḥ | puraḥ-gavī || anāmayitnu-bhyām | tvā | tābhyām | tvā | upa | spr̥śāmasi ||10.137.7||

IAST: tava tya indra sakhyeṣu vahnaya ṛtam manvānā vy adardirur valam
Griffith: ALLIED with thee in friendship, Indra, these, thy priests, remembering Hol
Devanāgarī: तव त्य इन्द्र सख्येषु वह्नय ऋतं मन्वाना व्यदर्दिरुर्वलम्
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | indra | sakhyeṣu | vahnayaḥ | r̥tam | manvānāḥ | vi | adardiruḥ | valam || yatra | daśasyan | uṣasaḥ | riṇan | apaḥ | kutsāya | manman | ahyaḥ | ca | daṁsayaḥ ||10.138.1||

IAST: yatrā daśasyann uṣaso riṇann apaḥ kutsāya manmann ahyaś ca daṁsayaḥ
Griffith: When they bestowed the Dawns and let the waters flow, and when thou dids
Devanāgarī: यत्रा दशस्यन्नुषसो रिणन्नपः कुत्साय मन्मन्नह्यश्च दंसयः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | indra | sakhyeṣu | vahnayaḥ | r̥tam | manvānāḥ | vi | adardiruḥ | valam || yatra | daśasyan | uṣasaḥ | riṇan | apaḥ | kutsāya | manman | ahyaḥ | ca | daṁsayaḥ ||10.138.1||

IAST: avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayo girīn ud āja usrā apibo madhu priyam
Griffith: Thou sentest forth productive powers, clavest the hills, thou dravest fort
Devanāgarī: अवासृजः प्रस्वः श्वञ्चयो गिरीनुदाज उस्रा अपिबो मधु प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: ava | asr̥jaḥ | pra-svaḥ | śvañcayaḥ | girīn | ut | ājaḥ | usrāḥ | apibaḥ | madhu | priyam || avardhayaḥ | vaninaḥ | asya | daṁsasā | śuśoca | sūryaḥ | r̥ta-jātayā | girā ||10.138.2||

IAST: avardhayo vanino asya daṁsasā śuśoca sūrya ṛtajātayā girā
Griffith: Thou gavest increase through this Tree's surpassing might. The Sun shone
Devanāgarī: अवर्धयो वनिनो अस्य दंससा शुशोच सूर्य ऋतजातया गिरा
pada pāṭha: ava | asr̥jaḥ | pra-svaḥ | śvañcayaḥ | girīn | ut | ājaḥ | usrāḥ | apibaḥ | madhu | priyam || avardhayaḥ | vaninaḥ | asya | daṁsasā | śuśoca | sūryaḥ | r̥ta-jātayā | girā ||10.138.2||

IAST: vi sūryo madhye amucad rathaṁ divo vidad dāsāya pratimānam āryaḥ
Griffith: In the mid-way of heaven the Sun unyoked his car: the Arya found a match t
Devanāgarī: वि सूर्यो मध्ये अमुचद्रथं दिवो विदद्दासाय प्रतिमानमार्यः
pada pāṭha: vi | sūryaḥ | madhye | amucat | ratham | divaḥ | vidat | dāsāya | prati-mānam | āryaḥ || dr̥ḷhāni | piproḥ | asurasya | māyinaḥ | indraḥ | vi | āsyat | cakr̥-vān | r̥jiśvanā ||10.138.3||

IAST: dṛḻhāni pipror asurasya māyina indro vy āsyac cakṛvām̐ ṛjiśvanā
Griffith: Associate with Rjisvan Indra overthrew the solid forts of Pipru, conjuri
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हानि पिप्रोरसुरस्य मायिन इन्द्रो व्यास्यच्चकृवाँ ऋजिश्वना
pada pāṭha: vi | sūryaḥ | madhye | amucat | ratham | divaḥ | vidat | dāsāya | prati-mānam | āryaḥ || dr̥ḷhāni | piproḥ | asurasya | māyinaḥ | indraḥ | vi | āsyat | cakr̥-vān | r̥jiśvanā ||10.138.3||

IAST: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣito vy āsyan nidhīm̐r adevām̐ amṛṇad ayāsyaḥ
Griffith: He boldly cast down forts which none had e'er assailed: unwearied he destr

pada pāṭha: ayam | agne | jaritā | tve iti | abhūt | api | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | nahi | anyat | asti | āpyam || bhadram | hi | śarma | tri-varūtham | asti | te | āre | hiṁsānām | apa | didyum | ā | kr̥dhi ||10.142.1||

pada pāṭha: pra-vat | te | agne | janima | pitu-yataḥ | sācī-iva | viśvā | bhuvanā | ni | r̥ñjase || pra | saptayaḥ | pra | saniṣanta | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | puraḥ | caranti | paśupāḥ-iva | tmanā ||10.142.2||

pada pāṭha: prati | asya | śreṇayaḥ | dadr̥śre | ekam | ni-yānam | bahavaḥ | rathāsaḥ || bāhū iti | yat | agne | anu-marmr̥jānaḥ | nyaṅ | uttānām | anu-eṣi | bhūmim ||10.142.5||

pada pāṭha: tyam | cit | aśvam | na | vājinam | areṇavaḥ | yam | atnata || dr̥ḷham | granthim | na | vi | syatam | atrim | yaviṣṭham | ā | rajaḥ ||10.143.2||

pada pāṭha: cite | tat | vām | su-rādhasā | rātiḥ | su-matiḥ | aśvinā || ā | yat | naḥ | sadane | pr̥thau | samane | parṣathaḥ | narā ||10.143.4||

Griffith: Like fresh full waters to a well, so, Heroes come and be with us.

Griffith: THIS deathless Indu, like a steed, strong and of full vitality,
