Griffith: Guarded by Vayu, Gods and men who sacrifice draw near to Faith.
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धां देवा यजमाना वायुगोपा उपासते
pada pāṭha: śraddhām | devāḥ | yajamānāḥ | vāyu-gopāḥ | upa | āsate || śraddhām | hr̥dayyayā | ā-kūtyā | śraddhayā | vindate | vasu ||10.151.4||

IAST: śraddhāṁ hṛdayyayākūtyā śraddhayā vindate vasu
Griffith: Man winneth Faith by yearnings of the heart, and opulence by Faith.
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धां हृदय्ययाकूत्या श्रद्धया विन्दते वसु
pada pāṭha: śraddhām | devāḥ | yajamānāḥ | vāyu-gopāḥ | upa | āsate || śraddhām | hr̥dayyayā | ā-kūtyā | śraddhayā | vindate | vasu ||10.151.4||

IAST: śraddhām prātar havāmahe śraddhām madhyaṁdinam pari
Griffith: Faith in the early morning, Faith at noonday will we invocate,
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धां प्रातर्हवामहे श्रद्धां मध्यंदिनं परि
pada pāṭha: śraddhām | prātaḥ | havāmahe | śraddhām | madhyaṁdinam | pari || śraddhām | sūryasya | ni-mruci | śraddhe | śrat | dhāpaya | iha | naḥ ||10.151.5||

IAST: śraddhāṁ sūryasya nimruci śraddhe śrad dhāpayeha naḥ
Griffith: Faith at the setting of the Sun. O Faith, endow us with belief.
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धां सूर्यस्य निम्रुचि श्रद्धे श्रद्धापयेह नः
pada pāṭha: śraddhām | prātaḥ | havāmahe | śraddhām | madhyaṁdinam | pari || śraddhām | sūryasya | ni-mruci | śraddhe | śrat | dhāpaya | iha | naḥ ||10.151.5||

IAST: śāsa itthā mahām̐ asy amitrakhādo adbhutaḥ
Griffith: A MIGHTY Governor art thou, Wondrous, Destroyer of the foe,
Devanāgarī: शास इत्था महाँ अस्यमित्रखादो अद्भुतः
pada pāṭha: śāsaḥ | itthā | mahān | asi | amitra-khādaḥ | adbhutaḥ || na | yasya | hanyate | sakhā | na | jīyate | kadā | cana ||10.152.1||

IAST: na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
Griffith: Whose friend is never done to death, and never, never overcome.
Devanāgarī: न यस्य हन्यते सखा न जीयते कदा चन
pada pāṭha: śāsaḥ | itthā | mahān | asi | amitra-khādaḥ | adbhutaḥ || na | yasya | hanyate | sakhā | na | jīyate | kadā | cana ||10.152.1||

IAST: svastidā viśas patir vṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī
Griffith: Lord of the clan, who brings us bliss, Strong, Warrior, Slayer of the fien
Devanāgarī: स्वस्तिदा विशस्पतिर्वृत्रहा विमृधो वशी
pada pāṭha: svasti-dāḥ | viśaḥ | patiḥ | vr̥tra-hā | vi-mr̥dhaḥ | vaśī || vr̥ṣā | indraḥ | puraḥ | etu | naḥ | soma-pāḥ | abhayam-karaḥ ||10.152.2||

IAST: vṛṣendraḥ pura etu naḥ somapā abhayaṁkaraḥ
Griffith: May India, Soma-drinker, go before us, Bull who gives us peace.
Devanāgarī: वृषेन्द्रः पुर एतु नः सोमपा अभयंकरः
pada pāṭha: svasti-dāḥ | viśaḥ | patiḥ | vr̥tra-hā | vi-mr̥dhaḥ | vaśī || vr̥ṣā | indraḥ | puraḥ | etu | naḥ | soma-pāḥ | abhayam-karaḥ ||10.152.2||

IAST: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja
Griffith: Drive Raksasas and foes away, break thou in pieces Vrtra'sjaws:
Devanāgarī: वि रक्षो वि मृधो जहि वि वृत्रस्य हनू रुज
pada pāṭha: vi | rakṣaḥ | vi | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi | vi | vr̥trasya | hanū iti | ruja || vi | manyum | indra | vr̥tra-han | amitrasya | abhi-dāsataḥ ||10.152.3||

IAST: vi manyum indra vṛtrahann amitrasyābhidāsataḥ
Griffith: O Vrtra-slaying Indra, quell the foeman's wrath who threatens us.
Devanāgarī: वि मन्युमिन्द्र वृत्रहन्नमित्रस्याभिदासतः
pada pāṭha: vi | rakṣaḥ | vi | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi | vi | vr̥trasya | hanū iti | ruja || vi | manyum | indra | vr̥tra-han | amitrasya | abhi-dāsataḥ ||10.152.3||

IAST: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ
Griffith: O Indra, beat our foes away, humble the men who challenge us:
Devanāgarī: वि न इन्द्र मृधो जहि नीचा यच्छ पृतन्यतः
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | indra | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi | nīcā | yaccha | pr̥tanyataḥ || yaḥ | asmān | abhi-dāsati | adharam | gamaya | tamaḥ ||10.152.4||

IAST: yo asmām̐ abhidāsaty adharaṁ gamayā tamaḥ
Griffith: Send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्माँ अभिदासत्यधरं गमया तमः
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | indra | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi | nīcā | yaccha | pr̥tanyataḥ || yaḥ | asmān | abhi-dāsati | adharam | gamaya | tamaḥ ||10.152.4||

IAST: apendra dviṣato mano 'pa jijyāsato vadham
Griffith: Baffle the foeman's plan, ward off his weapon who would conquer us.
Devanāgarī: अपेन्द्र द्विषतो मनोऽप जिज्यासतो वधम्
pada pāṭha: apa | indra | dviṣataḥ | manaḥ | apa | jijyāsataḥ | vadham || vi | manyoḥ | śarma | yaccha | varīyaḥ | yavaya | vadham ||10.152.5||

IAST: vi manyoḥ śarma yaccha varīyo yavayā vadham
Griffith: Give shelter from his furious wrath, and keep his murdering dart afar.
Devanāgarī: वि मन्योः शर्म यच्छ वरीयो यवया वधम्
pada pāṭha: apa | indra | dviṣataḥ | manaḥ | apa | jijyāsataḥ | vadham || vi | manyoḥ | śarma | yaccha | varīyaḥ | yavaya | vadham ||10.152.5||

IAST: īṅkhayantīr apasyuva indraṁ jātam upāsate
Griffith: SWAYING about, the Active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth,
Devanāgarī: ईङ्खयन्तीरपस्युव इन्द्रं जातमुपासते
pada pāṭha: īṅkhayantīḥ | apasyuvaḥ | indram | jātam | upa | āsate || bhejānāsaḥ | su-vīryam ||10.153.1||

IAST: bhejānāsaḥ suvīryam
Griffith: And shared his great heroic might.
Devanāgarī: भेजानासः सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: īṅkhayantīḥ | apasyuvaḥ | indram | jātam | upa | āsate || bhejānāsaḥ | su-vīryam ||10.153.1||

IAST: tvam indra balād adhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ
Griffith: Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth:
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्र बलादधि सहसो जात ओजसः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | balāt | adhi | sahasaḥ | jātaḥ | ojasaḥ || tvam | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣā | it | asi ||10.153.2||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛṣan vṛṣed asi
Griffith: Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वृषन्वृषेदसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | balāt | adhi | sahasaḥ | jātaḥ | ojasaḥ || tvam | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣā | it | asi ||10.153.2||

IAST: tvam indrāsi vṛtrahā vy antarikṣam atiraḥ
Griffith: Thou art the Vrtra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament:
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्रासि वृत्रहा व्यन्तरिक्षमतिरः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | asi | vr̥tra-hā | vi | antarikṣam | atiraḥ || ut | dyām | astabhnāḥ | ojasā ||10.153.3||

IAST: ud dyām astabhnā ojasā
Griffith: Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.
Devanāgarī: उद्द्यामस्तभ्ना ओजसा
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | asi | vr̥tra-hā | vi | antarikṣam | atiraḥ || ut | dyām | astabhnāḥ | ojasā ||10.153.3||

IAST: tvam indra sajoṣasam arkam bibharṣi bāhvoḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee,
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्र सजोषसमर्कं बिभर्षि बाह्वोः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sa-joṣasam | arkam | bibharṣi | bāhvoḥ || vajram | śiśānaḥ | ojasā ||10.153.4||

IAST: vajraṁ śiśāna ojasā
Griffith: Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.
Devanāgarī: वज्रं शिशान ओजसा
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sa-joṣasam | arkam | bibharṣi | bāhvoḥ || vajram | śiśānaḥ | ojasā ||10.153.4||

IAST: tvam indrābhibhūr asi viśvā jātāny ojasā
Griffith: Thou, Indra, art preeminent over all creatures in thy might:
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्राभिभूरसि विश्वा जातान्योजसा
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | abhi-bhūḥ | asi | viśvā | jātāni | ojasā || saḥ | viśvāḥ | bhuvaḥ | ā | abhavaḥ ||10.153.5||

IAST: sa viśvā bhuva ābhavaḥ
Griffith: Thou hast pervaded every place.
Devanāgarī: स विश्वा भुव आभवः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | abhi-bhūḥ | asi | viśvā | jātāni | ojasā || saḥ | viśvāḥ | bhuvaḥ | ā | abhavaḥ ||10.153.5||

IAST: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam eka upāsate
Griffith: FOR some is Soma purified, some sit by sacrificial oil:
Devanāgarī: सोम एकेभ्यः पवते घृतमेक उपासते
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | ekebhyaḥ | pavate | ghr̥tam | eke | upa | āsate || yebhyaḥ | madhu | pra-dhāvati | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.1||

IAST: yebhyo madhu pradhāvati tām̐ś cid evāpi gacchatāt
Griffith: To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.
Devanāgarī: येभ्यो मधु प्रधावति ताँश्चिदेवापि गच्छतात्
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | ekebhyaḥ | pavate | ghr̥tam | eke | upa | āsate || yebhyaḥ | madhu | pra-dhāvati | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.1||

IAST: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyās tapasā ye svar yayuḥ
Griffith: Invincible through Fervour, those whom Fervour hath advanced to heaven,
Devanāgarī: तपसा ये अनाधृष्यास्तपसा ये स्वर्ययुः
pada pāṭha: tapasā | ye | anādhr̥ṣyāḥ | tapasā | ye | svaḥ | yayuḥ || tapaḥ | ye | cakrire | mahaḥ | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.2||

IAST: tapo ye cakrire mahas tām̐ś cid evāpi gacchatāt
Griffith: Who showed great Fervour in their lives, -even to those let him depart.
Devanāgarī: तपो ये चक्रिरे महस्ताँश्चिदेवापि गच्छतात्
pada pāṭha: tapasā | ye | anādhr̥ṣyāḥ | tapasā | ye | svaḥ | yayuḥ || tapaḥ | ye | cakrire | mahaḥ | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.2||

IAST: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye tanūtyajaḥ
Griffith: The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away,
Devanāgarī: ये युध्यन्ते प्रधनेषु शूरासो ये तनूत्यजः
pada pāṭha: ye | yudhyante | pra-dhaneṣu | śūrāsaḥ | ye | tanū-tyajaḥ || ye | vā | sahasra-dakṣiṇāḥ | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.3||

IAST: ye vā sahasradakṣiṇās tām̐ś cid evāpi gacchatāt
Griffith: Or who give guerdon thousandfold, -even to those let him depart.
Devanāgarī: ये वा सहस्रदक्षिणास्ताँश्चिदेवापि गच्छतात्
pada pāṭha: ye | yudhyante | pra-dhaneṣu | śūrāsaḥ | ye | tanū-tyajaḥ || ye | vā | sahasra-dakṣiṇāḥ | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.3||

IAST: ye cit pūrva ṛtasāpa ṛtāvāna ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Yea, the first followers of Law, Law's pure and holy strengtheners,
Devanāgarī: ये चित्पूर्व ऋतसाप ऋतावान ऋतावृधः
pada pāṭha: ye | cit | pūrve | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || pitr̥̄n | tapasvataḥ | yama | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.4||

IAST: pitṝn tapasvato yama tām̐ś cid evāpi gacchatāt
Griffith: The Fathers, Yama! Fervour-moved,even to those let him depart.
Devanāgarī: पितॄन्तपस्वतो यम ताँश्चिदेवापि गच्छतात्
pada pāṭha: ye | cit | pūrve | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || pitr̥̄n | tapasvataḥ | yama | tān | cit | eva | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.4||

IAST: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye gopāyanti sūryam
Griffith: Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun,
Devanāgarī: सहस्रणीथाः कवयो ये गोपायन्ति सूर्यम्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-nīthāḥ | kavayaḥ | ye | gopāyanti | sūryam || r̥ṣīn | tapasvataḥ | yama | tapaḥ-jān | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.5||

IAST: ṛṣīn tapasvato yama tapojām̐ api gacchatāt
Griffith: The Rsis, Yama! Fervour-moved,-even to those let him depart.
Devanāgarī: ऋषीन्तपस्वतो यम तपोजाँ अपि गच्छतात्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-nīthāḥ | kavayaḥ | ye | gopāyanti | sūryam || r̥ṣīn | tapasvataḥ | yama | tapaḥ-jān | api | gacchatāt ||10.154.5||

IAST: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe giriṁ gaccha sadānve
Griffith: ARAYI, one-eyed limping hag, fly, ever-screeching, to the hill.
Devanāgarī: अरायि काणे विकटे गिरिं गच्छ सदान्वे
pada pāṭha: arāyi | kāṇe | vi-kaṭe | girim | gaccha | sadānve || śirimbiṭhasya | satva-bhiḥ | tebhiḥ | tvā | cātayāmasi ||10.155.1||

IAST: śirimbiṭhasya satvabhis tebhiṣ ṭvā cātayāmasi
Griffith: We frighten thee away with these, the heroes of Sirimbitha.
Devanāgarī: शिरिम्बिठस्य सत्वभिस्तेभिष्ट्वा चातयामसि
pada pāṭha: arāyi | kāṇe | vi-kaṭe | girim | gaccha | sadānve || śirimbiṭhasya | satva-bhiḥ | tebhiḥ | tvā | cātayāmasi ||10.155.1||

IAST: catto itaś cattāmutaḥ sarvā bhrūṇāny āruṣī
Griffith: Scared from this place and that is she, destroyer of each germ unborn.
Devanāgarī: चत्तो इतश्चत्तामुतः सर्वा भ्रूणान्यारुषी
pada pāṭha: catto iti | itaḥ | cattā | amutaḥ | sarvā | bhrūṇāni | āruṣī || arāyyam | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tīkṣṇa-śr̥ṅga | ut-r̥ṣan | ihi ||10.155.2||

IAST: arāyyam brahmaṇas pate tīkṣṇaśṛṇgodṛṣann ihi
Griffith: Go, sharp-horned Brahmanaspti and drive Arayi far away.
Devanāgarī: अराय्यं ब्रह्मणस्पते तीक्ष्णशृण्गोदृषन्निहि
pada pāṭha: catto iti | itaḥ | cattā | amutaḥ | sarvā | bhrūṇāni | āruṣī || arāyyam | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tīkṣṇa-śr̥ṅga | ut-r̥ṣan | ihi ||10.155.2||

IAST: ado yad dāru plavate sindhoḥ pāre apūruṣam
Griffith: Yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the river's edge,-
Devanāgarī: अदो यद्दारु प्लवते सिन्धोः पारे अपूरुषम्
pada pāṭha: adaḥ | yat | dāru | plavate | sindhoḥ | pāre | apuruṣam || tat | ā | rabhasva | durhano iti duḥ-hano | tena | gaccha | paraḥ-taram ||10.155.3||

IAST: tad ā rabhasva durhaṇo tena gaccha parastaram
Griffith: Seize it, thou thing with hideous jaws, and go thou far away thereon.
Devanāgarī: तदा रभस्व दुर्हणो तेन गच्छ परस्तरम्
pada pāṭha: adaḥ | yat | dāru | plavate | sindhoḥ | pāre | apuruṣam || tat | ā | rabhasva | durhano iti duḥ-hano | tena | gaccha | paraḥ-taram ||10.155.3||

IAST: yad dha prācīr ajagantoro maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ
Griffith: When, foul with secret stain and spot, ye hastened onward to the breast,
Devanāgarī: यद्ध प्राचीरजगन्तोरो मण्डूरधाणिकीः
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | prācīḥ | ajaganta | uraḥ | maṇḍūra-dhāṇikīḥ || hatāḥ | indrasya | śatravaḥ | sarve | budbuda-yāśavaḥ ||10.155.4||

IAST: hatā indrasya śatravaḥ sarve budbudayāśavaḥ
Griffith: All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.
Devanāgarī: हता इन्द्रस्य शत्रवः सर्वे बुद्बुदयाशवः
pada pāṭha: yat | ha | prācīḥ | ajaganta | uraḥ | maṇḍūra-dhāṇikīḥ || hatāḥ | indrasya | śatravaḥ | sarve | budbuda-yāśavaḥ ||10.155.4||

IAST: parīme gām aneṣata pary agnim ahṛṣata
Griffith: These men have led about the cow, have duly carried Agni round,
Devanāgarī: परीमे गामनेषत पर्यग्निमहृषत
pada pāṭha: pari | ime | gām | aneṣata | pari | agnim | ahr̥ṣata || deveṣu | akrata | śravaḥ | kaḥ | imān | ā | dadharṣati ||10.155.5||

IAST: deveṣv akrata śravaḥ ka imām̐ ā dadharṣati
Griffith: And raised their glory tg the Gods. Who will attack them with success?
Devanāgarī: देवेष्वक्रत श्रवः क इमाँ आ दधर्षति
pada pāṭha: pari | ime | gām | aneṣata | pari | agnim | ahr̥ṣata || deveṣu | akrata | śravaḥ | kaḥ | imān | ā | dadharṣati ||10.155.5||

IAST: agniṁ hinvantu no dhiyaḥ saptim āśum ivājiṣu
Griffith: LET songs of ours speed Agni forth like a fleet courser in the race,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं हिन्वन्तु नो धियः सप्तिमाशुमिवाजिषु
pada pāṭha: agnim | hinvantu | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | saptim | āśum-iva | ājiṣu || tena | jeṣma | dhanam-dhanam ||10.156.1||

IAST: tena jeṣma dhanaṁ-dhanam
Griffith: And we will win each prize through him.
Devanāgarī: तेन जेष्म धनंधनम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | hinvantu | naḥ | dhiyaḥ | saptim | āśum-iva | ājiṣu || tena | jeṣma | dhanam-dhanam ||10.156.1||

IAST: yayā gā ākarāmahe senayāgne tavotyā
Griffith: Agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with help from thee,-
Devanāgarī: यया गा आकरामहे सेनयाग्ने तवोत्या
pada pāṭha: yayā | gāḥ | ā-karāmahe | senayā | agne | tava | ūtyā || tām | naḥ | hinva | maghattaye ||10.156.2||

IAST: tāṁ no hinva maghattaye
Griffith: That send us for the gain of wealth.
Devanāgarī: तां नो हिन्व मघत्तये
pada pāṭha: yayā | gāḥ | ā-karāmahe | senayā | agne | tava | ūtyā || tām | naḥ | hinva | maghattaye ||10.156.2||

IAST: āgne sthūraṁ rayim bhara pṛthuṁ gomantam aśvinam
Griffith: O Agni, bring us wealth secure, vast wealth in horses and in kine:
Devanāgarī: आग्ने स्थूरं रयिं भर पृथुं गोमन्तमश्विनम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | sthūram | rayim | bhara | pr̥thum | go-mantam | aśvinam || aṅdhi | kham | vartaya | paṇim ||10.156.3||

IAST: aṅdhi khaṁ vartayā paṇim
Griffith: Oil thou the socket, turn the wheel.
Devanāgarī: अङ्धि खं वर्तया पणिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | sthūram | rayim | bhara | pr̥thum | go-mantam | aśvinam || aṅdhi | kham | vartaya | paṇim ||10.156.3||

IAST: agne nakṣatram ajaram ā sūryaṁ rohayo divi
Griffith: O Agni, thou hast made the Sun, Eternal Star, to mount the sky,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने नक्षत्रमजरमा सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि
pada pāṭha: agne | nakṣatram | ajaram | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi || dadhat | jyotiḥ | janebhyaḥ ||10.156.4||

IAST: dadhaj jyotir janebhyaḥ
Griffith: Bestowing light on living men.
Devanāgarī: दधज्ज्योतिर्जनेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: agne | nakṣatram | ajaram | ā | sūryam | rohayaḥ | divi || dadhat | jyotiḥ | janebhyaḥ ||10.156.4||

IAST: agne ketur viśām asi preṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭha upasthasat
Griffith: Thou, Agni, art the people's light, best, dearest, seated in thy shrine:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने केतुर्विशामसि प्रेष्ठः श्रेष्ठ उपस्थसत्
pada pāṭha: agne | ketuḥ | viśām | asi | preṣṭhaḥ | śreṣṭhaḥ | upastha-sat || bodha | stotre | vayaḥ | dadhat ||10.156.5||

IAST: bodhā stotre vayo dadhat
Griffith: Watch for the singer, give him life.
Devanāgarī: बोधा स्तोत्रे वयो दधत्
pada pāṭha: agne | ketuḥ | viśām | asi | preṣṭhaḥ | śreṣṭhaḥ | upastha-sat || bodha | stotre | vayaḥ | dadhat ||10.156.5||

IAST: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraś ca viśve ca devāḥ
Griffith: WE will, with Indra and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing worlds in
Devanāgarī: इमा नु कं भुवना सीषधामेन्द्रश्च विश्वे च देवाः
pada pāṭha: imā | nu | kam | bhuvanā | sīsadhāma | indraḥ | ca | viśve | ca | devāḥ ||10.157.1||

IAST: yajñaṁ ca nas tanvaṁ ca prajāṁ cādityair indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti
Griffith: Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspr. let Indra form together with Ad
Devanāgarī: यज्ञं च नस्तन्वं च प्रजां चादित्यैरिन्द्रः सह चीकॢपाति
pada pāṭha: yajñam | ca | naḥ | tanvam | ca | pra-jām | ca | ādityaiḥ | indraḥ | saha | cīkl̥pāti ||10.157.2||

IAST: ādityair indraḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmākam bhūtv avitā tanūnām
Griffith: With the Adityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra be Protector of our b
Devanāgarī: आदित्यैरिन्द्रः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्माकं भूत्वविता तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ādityaiḥ | indraḥ | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ | asmākam | bhūtu | avitā | tanūnām ||10.157.3||

IAST: hatvāya devā asurān yad āyan devā devatvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: As when the Gods came, after they had slaughtered the Asuras, keeping safe
Devanāgarī: हत्वाय देवा असुरान्यदायन्देवा देवत्वमभिरक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: hatvāya | devāḥ | asurān | yat | āyan | devāḥ | deva-tvam | abhi-rakṣamāṇāḥ ||10.157.4||

IAST: pratyañcam arkam anayañ chacībhir ād it svadhām iṣirām pary apaśyan
Griffith: Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked about them on th
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यञ्चमर्कमनयञ्छचीभिरादित्स्वधामिषिरां पर्यपश्यन्
pada pāṭha: pratyañcam | arkam | anayan | śacībhiḥ | āt | it | svadhām | iṣirām | pari | apaśyan ||10.157.5||

IAST: sūryo no divas pātu vāto antarikṣāt
Griffith: MAY Surya guard us out of heaven, and Vata from the firmament,
Devanāgarī: सूर्यो नो दिवस्पातु वातो अन्तरिक्षात्
pada pāṭha: sūryaḥ | naḥ | divaḥ | pātu | vātaḥ | antarikṣāt || agniḥ | naḥ | pārthivebhyaḥ ||10.158.1||

IAST: agnir naḥ pārthivebhyaḥ
Griffith: And Agni from terrestrial spots.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्नः पार्थिवेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: sūryaḥ | naḥ | divaḥ | pātu | vātaḥ | antarikṣāt || agniḥ | naḥ | pārthivebhyaḥ ||10.158.1||

IAST: joṣā savitar yasya te haraḥ śataṁ savām̐ arhati
Griffith: Thou Savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations, be thou pleased:
Devanāgarī: जोषा सवितर्यस्य ते हरः शतं सवाँ अर्हति
pada pāṭha: joṣa | savitaḥ | yasya | te | haraḥ | śatam | savān | arhati || pāhi | naḥ | didyutaḥ | patantyāḥ ||10.158.2||

IAST: pāhi no didyutaḥ patantyāḥ
Griffith: From failing lightning keep us safe.
Devanāgarī: पाहि नो दिद्युतः पतन्त्याः
pada pāṭha: joṣa | savitaḥ | yasya | te | haraḥ | śatam | savān | arhati || pāhi | naḥ | didyutaḥ | patantyāḥ ||10.158.2||

IAST: cakṣur no devaḥ savitā cakṣur na uta parvataḥ

Devanāgarī: चक्षुर्नो देवः सविता चक्षुर्न उत पर्वतः
pada pāṭha: cakṣuḥ | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | cakṣuḥ | naḥ | uta | parvataḥ || cakṣuḥ | dhātā | dadhātu | naḥ ||10.158.3||

IAST: cakṣur dhātā dadhātu naḥ
Griffith: May the Creator give us sight.
Devanāgarī: चक्षुर्धाता दधातु नः
pada pāṭha: cakṣuḥ | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | cakṣuḥ | naḥ | uta | parvataḥ || cakṣuḥ | dhātā | dadhātu | naḥ ||10.158.3||

IAST: cakṣur no dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣur vikhyai tanūbhyaḥ
Griffith: Give sight unto our eye, give thou our bodies sight that they may see:
Devanāgarī: चक्षुर्नो धेहि चक्षुषे चक्षुर्विख्यै तनूभ्यः
pada pāṭha: cakṣuḥ | naḥ | dhehi | cakṣuṣe | cakṣuḥ | vi-khyai | tanūbhyaḥ || sam | ca | idam | vi | ca | paśyema ||10.158.4||

IAST: saṁ cedaṁ vi ca paśyema
Griffith: May we survey, discern this world.
Devanāgarī: सं चेदं वि च पश्येम
pada pāṭha: cakṣuḥ | naḥ | dhehi | cakṣuṣe | cakṣuḥ | vi-khyai | tanūbhyaḥ || sam | ca | idam | vi | ca | paśyema ||10.158.4||

IAST: susaṁdṛśaṁ tvā vayam prati paśyema sūrya
Griffith: Thus, Surya, may we look on thee, on thee most lovely to behold,
Devanāgarī: सुसंदृशं त्वा वयं प्रति पश्येम सूर्य
pada pāṭha: su-saṁdr̥śam | tvā | vayam | prati | paśyema | sūrya || vi | paśyema | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||10.158.5||

IAST: vi paśyema nṛcakṣasaḥ
Griffith: See clearly with the eyes of men.
Devanāgarī: वि पश्येम नृचक्षसः
pada pāṭha: su-saṁdr̥śam | tvā | vayam | prati | paśyema | sūrya || vi | paśyema | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ ||10.158.5||

IAST: ud asau sūryo agād ud ayam māmako bhagaḥ
Griffith: YON Sun hath mounted up, and this my happy fate hate mounted high.
Devanāgarī: उदसौ सूर्यो अगादुदयं मामको भगः
pada pāṭha: ut | asau | sūryaḥ | agāt | ut | ayam | māmakaḥ | bhagaḥ || aham | tat | vidvalā | patim | abhi | āsākṣi | vi-sasahiḥ ||10.159.1||

IAST: ahaṁ tad vidvalā patim abhy asākṣi viṣāsahiḥ
Griffith: I knowing this, as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.
Devanāgarī: अहं तद्विद्वला पतिमभ्यसाक्षि विषासहिः
pada pāṭha: ut | asau | sūryaḥ | agāt | ut | ayam | māmakaḥ | bhagaḥ || aham | tat | vidvalā | patim | abhi | āsākṣi | vi-sasahiḥ ||10.159.1||

IAST: ahaṁ ketur aham mūrdhāham ugrā vivācanī
Griffith: I am the banner and the head, a mighty arbitress am I:
Devanāgarī: अहं केतुरहं मूर्धाहमुग्रा विवाचनी
pada pāṭha: aham | ketuḥ | aham | mūrdhā | aham | ugrā | vi-vācanī || mama | it | anu | kratum | patiḥ | sehānāyāḥ | upa-ācaret ||10.159.2||

IAST: mamed anu kratum patiḥ sehānāyā upācaret
Griffith: I am victorious, and my Lord shall be submissive to my will.
Devanāgarī: ममेदनु क्रतुं पतिः सेहानाया उपाचरेत्
pada pāṭha: aham | ketuḥ | aham | mūrdhā | aham | ugrā | vi-vācanī || mama | it | anu | kratum | patiḥ | sehānāyāḥ | upa-ācaret ||10.159.2||

IAST: mama putrāḥ śatruhaṇo 'tho me duhitā virāṭ
Griffith: My Sons are slayers of the foe, my Daughter is a ruling Queen:
Devanāgarī: मम पुत्राः शत्रुहणोऽथो मे दुहिता विराट्
pada pāṭha: mama | putrāḥ | śatru-hanaḥ | atho iti | me | duhitā | virāṭ || uta | aham | asmi | sam-jayā | patyau | me | ślokaḥ | ut-tamaḥ ||10.159.3||

IAST: utāham asmi saṁjayā patyau me śloka uttamaḥ
Griffith: I am victorious: o'er my Lord my song of triumph is supreme.
Devanāgarī: उताहमस्मि संजया पत्यौ मे श्लोक उत्तमः
pada pāṭha: mama | putrāḥ | śatru-hanaḥ | atho iti | me | duhitā | virāṭ || uta | aham | asmi | sam-jayā | patyau | me | ślokaḥ | ut-tamaḥ ||10.159.3||

IAST: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvy abhavad dyumny uttamaḥ
Griffith: Oblation, that which Indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high,-
Devanāgarī: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कृत्व्यभवद्द्युम्न्युत्तमः
pada pāṭha: yena | indraḥ | haviṣā | kr̥tvī | abhavat | dyumnī | ut-tamaḥ || idam | tat | akri | devāḥ | asapatnā | kila | abhuvam ||10.159.4||

IAST: idaṁ tad akri devā asapatnā kilābhuvam
Griffith: This have I offered, O ye Gods, and rid me of each rival wife.
Devanāgarī: इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्ना किलाभुवम्
pada pāṭha: yena | indraḥ | haviṣā | kr̥tvī | abhavat | dyumnī | ut-tamaḥ || idam | tat | akri | devāḥ | asapatnā | kila | abhuvam ||10.159.4||

IAST: asapatnā sapatnaghnī jayanty abhibhūvarī
Griffith: Destroyer of the rival wife, Sole Spouse, victorious, conqueror,
Devanāgarī: असपत्ना सपत्नघ्नी जयन्त्यभिभूवरी
pada pāṭha: asapatnā | sapatna-ghnī | jayantī | abhi-bhūvarī || ā | avr̥kṣam | anyāsām | varcaḥ | rādhaḥ | astheyasām-iva ||10.159.5||

IAST: āvṛkṣam anyāsāṁ varco rādho astheyasām iva
Griffith: The others' glory have I seized as 'twere the wealth of weaker Dames.
Devanāgarī: आवृक्षमन्यासां वर्चो राधो अस्थेयसामिव
pada pāṭha: asapatnā | sapatna-ghnī | jayantī | abhi-bhūvarī || ā | avr̥kṣam | anyāsām | varcaḥ | rādhaḥ | astheyasām-iva ||10.159.5||

IAST: sam ajaiṣam imā ahaṁ sapatnīr abhibhūvarī
Griffith: I have subdued as conqueror these rivals, these my fellow-wives,
Devanāgarī: समजैषमिमा अहं सपत्नीरभिभूवरी
pada pāṭha: sam | ajaiṣam | imāḥ | aham | sa-patnīḥ | abhi-bhūvarī || yathā | aham | asya | vīrasya | vi-rājāni | janasya | ca ||10.159.6||

IAST: yathāham asya vīrasya virājāni janasya ca
Griffith: That I may hold imperial sway over this Hero and the folk.
Devanāgarī: यथाहमस्य वीरस्य विराजानि जनस्य च
pada pāṭha: sam | ajaiṣam | imāḥ | aham | sa-patnīḥ | abhi-bhūvarī || yathā | aham | asya | vīrasya | vi-rājāni | janasya | ca ||10.159.6||

IAST: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarvarathā vi harī iha muñca
Griffith: TASTE this strong draught enriched with offered viands: with all thy chari
Devanāgarī: तीव्रस्याभिवयसो अस्य पाहि सर्वरथा वि हरी इह मुञ्च
pada pāṭha: tīvrasya | abhi-vayasaḥ | asya | pāhi | sarva-rathā | vi | harī iti | iha | muñca || indra | mā | tvā | yajamānāsaḥ | anye | ni | rīraman | tubhyam | ime | sutāsaḥ ||10.160.1||

IAST: indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyam ime sutāsaḥ
Griffith: Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र मा त्वा यजमानासो अन्ये नि रीरमन्तुभ्यमिमे सुतासः
pada pāṭha: tīvrasya | abhi-vayasaḥ | asya | pāhi | sarva-rathā | vi | harī iti | iha | muñca || indra | mā | tvā | yajamānāsaḥ | anye | ni | rīraman | tubhyam | ime | sutāsaḥ ||10.160.1||

IAST: tubhyaṁ sutās tubhyam u sotvāsas tvāṁ giraḥ śvātryā ā hvayanti
Griffith: Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our re
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं सुतास्तुभ्यमु सोत्वासस्त्वां गिरः श्वात्र्या आ ह्वयन्ति
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | sutāḥ | tubhyam | ūm̐ iti | sotvāsaḥ | tvām | giraḥ | śvātryāḥ | ā | hvayanti || indra | idam | adya | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | viśvasya | vidvān | iha | pāhi | somam ||10.160.2||

IAST: indredam adya savanaṁ juṣāṇo viśvasya vidvām̐ iha pāhi somam
Griffith: O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all a
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेदमद्य सवनं जुषाणो विश्वस्य विद्वाँ इह पाहि सोमम्
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | sutāḥ | tubhyam | ūm̐ iti | sotvāsaḥ | tvām | giraḥ | śvātryāḥ | ā | hvayanti || indra | idam | adya | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | viśvasya | vidvān | iha | pāhi | somam ||10.160.2||

IAST: ya uśatā manasā somam asmai sarvahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti
Griffith: Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and sp
Devanāgarī: य उशता मनसा सोममस्मै सर्वहृदा देवकामः सुनोति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | uśatā | manasā | somam | asmai | sarva-hr̥dā | deva-kāmaḥ | sunoti || na | gāḥ | indraḥ | tasya | parā | dadāti | pra-śastam | it | cārum | asmai | kr̥ṇoti ||10.160.3||

IAST: na gā indras tasya parā dadāti praśastam ic cārum asmai kṛṇoti
Griffith: Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma
Devanāgarī: न गा इन्द्रस्तस्य परा ददाति प्रशस्तमिच्चारुमस्मै कृणोति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | uśatā | manasā | somam | asmai | sarva-hr̥dā | deva-kāmaḥ | sunoti || na | gāḥ | indraḥ | tasya | parā | dadāti | pra-śastam | it | cārum | asmai | kr̥ṇoti ||10.160.3||

IAST: anuspaṣṭo bhavaty eṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam
Griffith: He looks with Ioving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for
Devanāgarī: अनुस्पष्टो भवत्येषो अस्य यो अस्मै रेवान्न सुनोति सोमम्
pada pāṭha: anu-spaṣṭaḥ | bhavati | eṣaḥ | asya | yaḥ | asmai | revān | na | sunoti | somam || niḥ | aratnau | magha-vā | tam | dadhāti | brahma-dviṣaḥ | hanti | ananu-diṣṭaḥ ||10.160.4||

IAST: nir aratnau maghavā taṁ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hanty anānudiṣṭaḥ
Griffith: Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who
Devanāgarī: निररत्नौ मघवा तं दधाति ब्रह्मद्विषो हन्त्यनानुदिष्टः
pada pāṭha: anu-spaṣṭaḥ | bhavati | eṣaḥ | asya | yaḥ | asmai | revān | na | sunoti | somam || niḥ | aratnau | magha-vā | tam | dadhāti | brahma-dviṣaḥ | hanti | ananu-diṣṭaḥ ||10.160.4||

IAST: aśvāyanto gavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopagantavā u
Griffith: We call on thee to come to us, desirous of goods and spoil, of cattle, and
Devanāgarī: अश्वायन्तो गव्यन्तो वाजयन्तो हवामहे त्वोपगन्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: aśva-yantaḥ | gavyantaḥ | vājayantaḥ | havāmahe | tvā | upa-gantavai | ūm̐ iti || ā-bhūṣantaḥ | te | su-matau | navāyām | vayam | indra | tvā | śunam | huvema ||10.160.5||

IAST: ābhūṣantas te sumatau navāyāṁ vayam indra tvā śunaṁ huvema
Griffith: For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, a
Devanāgarī: आभूषन्तस्ते सुमतौ नवायां वयमिन्द्र त्वा शुनं हुवेम
pada pāṭha: aśva-yantaḥ | gavyantaḥ | vājayantaḥ | havāmahe | tvā | upa-gantavai | ūm̐ iti || ā-bhūṣantaḥ | te | su-matau | navāyām | vayam | indra | tvā | śunam | huvema ||10.160.5||

IAST: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam ajñātayakṣmād uta rājayakṣmāt
Griffith: FOR life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and fro
Devanāgarī: मुञ्चामि त्वा हविषा जीवनाय कमज्ञातयक्ष्मादुत राजयक्ष्मात्
pada pāṭha: muñcāmi | tvā | haviṣā | jīvanāya | kam | ajñāta-yakṣmāt | uta | rāja-yakṣmāt || grāhiḥ | jagrāha | yadi | vā | etat | enam | tasyāḥ | indrāgnī iti | pra | mumuktam | enam ||10.161.1||

IAST: grāhir jagrāha yadi vaitad enaṁ tasyā indrāgnī pra mumuktam enam
Griffith: Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra
Devanāgarī: ग्राहिर्जग्राह यदि वैतदेनं तस्या इन्द्राग्नी प्र मुमुक्तमेनम्
pada pāṭha: muñcāmi | tvā | haviṣā | jīvanāya | kam | ajñāta-yakṣmāt | uta | rāja-yakṣmāt || grāhiḥ | jagrāha | yadi | vā | etat | enam | tasyāḥ | indrāgnī iti | pra | mumuktam | enam ||10.161.1||

IAST: yadi kṣitāyur yadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyor antikaṁ nīta eva
Griffith: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death al
Devanāgarī: यदि क्षितायुर्यदि वा परेतो यदि मृत्योरन्तिकं नीत एव
pada pāṭha: yadi | kṣita-āyuḥ | yadi | vā | parā-itaḥ | yadi | mr̥tyoḥ | antikam | ni-itaḥ | eva || tam | ā | harāmi | niḥ-r̥teḥ | upa-sthāt | aspārṣam | enam | śata-śāradāya ||10.161.2||

IAST: tam ā harāmi nirṛter upasthād aspārṣam enaṁ śataśāradāya
Griffith: Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a
Devanāgarī: तमा हरामि निरृतेरुपस्थादस्पार्षमेनं शतशारदाय
pada pāṭha: yadi | kṣita-āyuḥ | yadi | vā | parā-itaḥ | yadi | mr̥tyoḥ | antikam | ni-itaḥ | eva || tam | ā | harāmi | niḥ-r̥teḥ | upa-sthāt | aspārṣam | enam | śata-śāradāya ||10.161.2||

IAST: sahasrākṣeṇa śataśāradena śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣam enam
Griffith: With hundred-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, ha
Devanāgarī: सहस्राक्षेण शतशारदेन शतायुषा हविषाहार्षमेनम्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-akṣeṇa | śata-śāradena | śata-āyuṣā | haviṣā | ā | ahārṣam | enam || śatam | yathā | imam | śaradaḥ | nayāti | indraḥ | viśvasya | duḥ-itasya | pāram ||10.161.3||

IAST: śataṁ yathemaṁ śarado nayātīndro viśvasya duritasya pāram
Griffith: That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of
Devanāgarī: शतं यथेमं शरदो नयातीन्द्रो विश्वस्य दुरितस्य पारम्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-akṣeṇa | śata-śāradena | śata-āyuṣā | haviṣā | ā | ahārṣam | enam || śatam | yathā | imam | śaradaḥ | nayāti | indraḥ | viśvasya | duḥ-itasya | pāram ||10.161.3||

IAST: śataṁ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṁ hemantāñ chatam u vasantān
Griffith: Live, waxing in thy strength, a hundred autumns, live through a hundred sp
Devanāgarī: शतं जीव शरदो वर्धमानः शतं हेमन्ताञ्छतमु वसन्तान्
pada pāṭha: śatam | jīva | śaradaḥ | vardhamānaḥ | śatam | hemantān | śatam | ūm̐ iti | vasantān || śatam | indrāgnī iti | savitā | br̥haspatiḥ | śata-āyuṣā | haviṣā | imam | punaḥ | duḥ ||10.161.4||

IAST: śatam indrāgnī savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣā haviṣemam punar duḥ
Griffith: Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Brhaspati, Savitar yield him
Devanāgarī: शतमिन्द्राग्नी सविता बृहस्पतिः शतायुषा हविषेमं पुनर्दुः
pada pāṭha: śatam | jīva | śaradaḥ | vardhamānaḥ | śatam | hemantān | śatam | ūm̐ iti | vasantān || śatam | indrāgnī iti | savitā | br̥haspatiḥ | śata-āyuṣā | haviṣā | imam | punaḥ | duḥ ||10.161.4||

IAST: āhārṣaṁ tvāvidaṁ tvā punar āgāḥ punarnava
Griffith: So have I found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed.
Devanāgarī: आहार्षं त्वाविदं त्वा पुनरागाः पुनर्नव
pada pāṭha: ā | ahārṣam | tvā | avidam | tvā | punaḥ | ā | agāḥ | punaḥ-nava || sarva-aṅga | sarvam | te | cakṣuḥ | sarvam | āyuḥ | ca | te | avidam ||10.161.5||

IAST: sarvāṅga sarvaṁ te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuś ca te 'vidam
Griffith: Whole in thy members! I have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.
Devanāgarī: सर्वाङ्ग सर्वं ते चक्षुः सर्वमायुश्च तेऽविदम्
pada pāṭha: ā | ahārṣam | tvā | avidam | tvā | punaḥ | ā | agāḥ | punaḥ-nava || sarva-aṅga | sarvam | te | cakṣuḥ | sarvam | āyuḥ | ca | te | avidam ||10.161.5||

IAST: brahmaṇāgniḥ saṁvidāno rakṣohā bādhatām itaḥ
Griffith: MAY Agni, yielding to our prayer, the Raksas-slayer, drive away
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणाग्निः संविदानो रक्षोहा बाधतामितः
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇā | agniḥ | sam-vidānaḥ | rakṣaḥ-hā | bādhatām | itaḥ || amīvā | yaḥ | te | garbham | duḥ-nāmā | yonim | ā-śaye ||10.162.1||

IAST: amīvā yas te garbhaṁ durṇāmā yonim āśaye
Griffith: The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.
Devanāgarī: अमीवा यस्ते गर्भं दुर्णामा योनिमाशये
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇā | agniḥ | sam-vidānaḥ | rakṣaḥ-hā | bādhatām | itaḥ || amīvā | yaḥ | te | garbham | duḥ-nāmā | yonim | ā-śaye ||10.162.1||

IAST: yas te garbham amīvā durṇāmā yonim āśaye
Griffith: Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of the flesh,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते गर्भममीवा दुर्णामा योनिमाशये
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | garbham | amīvā | duḥ-nāmā | yonim | ā-śaye || agniḥ | tam | brahmaṇā | saha | niḥ | kravya-adam | anīnaśat ||10.162.2||

IAST: agniṣ ṭam brahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādam anīnaśat
Griffith: The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.
Devanāgarī: अग्निष्टं ब्रह्मणा सह निष्क्रव्यादमनीनशत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | garbham | amīvā | duḥ-nāmā | yonim | ā-śaye || agniḥ | tam | brahmaṇā | saha | niḥ | kravya-adam | anīnaśat ||10.162.2||

IAST: yas te hanti patayantaṁ niṣatsnuṁ yaḥ sarīsṛpam
Griffith: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते हन्ति पतयन्तं निषत्स्नुं यः सरीसृपम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | hanti | patayantam | ni-satsnum | yaḥ | sarīsr̥pam || jātam | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.3||

IAST: jātaṁ yas te jighāṁsati tam ito nāśayāmasi
Griffith: That which will kill the babe at birth,even this will we drive far away.
Devanāgarī: जातं यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | hanti | patayantam | ni-satsnum | yaḥ | sarīsr̥pam || jātam | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.3||

IAST: yas ta ūrū viharaty antarā dampatī śaye
Griffith: That which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair,
Devanāgarī: यस्त ऊरू विहरत्यन्तरा दम्पती शये
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | ūrū iti | vi-harati | antarā | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | śaye || yonim | yaḥ | antaḥ | ā-reḷhi | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.4||

IAST: yoniṁ yo antar āreḻhi tam ito nāśayāmasi
Griffith: That penetrates and licks thy side,-even this will we exterminate.
Devanāgarī: योनिं यो अन्तरारेळ्हि तमितो नाशयामसि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | ūrū iti | vi-harati | antarā | daṁpatī iti dam-patī | śaye || yonim | yaḥ | antaḥ | ā-reḷhi | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.4||

IAST: yas tvā bhrātā patir bhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate
Griffith: What rests by thee in borrowed form of brother, lover, or of lord,
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वा भ्राता पतिर्भूत्वा जारो भूत्वा निपद्यते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | bhrātā | patiḥ | bhūtvā | jāraḥ | bhūtvā | ni-padyate || pra-jām | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.5||

IAST: prajāṁ yas te jighāṁsati tam ito nāśayāmasi
Griffith: And would destroy thy Progeny,-even this will we exterminate.
Devanāgarī: प्रजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | bhrātā | patiḥ | bhūtvā | jāraḥ | bhūtvā | ni-padyate || pra-jām | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.5||

IAST: yas tvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate
Griffith: That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by t
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वा स्वप्नेन तमसा मोहयित्वा निपद्यते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | svapnena | tamasā | mohayitvā | ni-padyate || pra-jām | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.6||

IAST: prajāṁ yas te jighāṁsati tam ito nāśayāmasi
Griffith: And will destroy thy progeny,--even this will we exterminate.
Devanāgarī: प्रजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | svapnena | tamasā | mohayitvā | ni-padyate || pra-jām | yaḥ | te | jighāṁsati | tam | itaḥ | nāśayāmasi ||10.162.6||

IAST: akṣībhyāṁ te nāsikābhyāṁ karṇābhyāṁ chubukād adhi
Griffith: FROM both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy
Devanāgarī: अक्षीभ्यां ते नासिकाभ्यां कर्णाभ्यां छुबुकादधि
pada pāṭha: akṣībhyām | te | nāsikābhyām | karṇābhyām | chubukāt | adhi || yakṣmam | śīrṣaṇyam | mastiṣkāt | jihvāyāḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.1||

IAST: yakṣmaṁ śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāj jihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं मस्तिष्काज्जिह्वाया वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: akṣībhyām | te | nāsikābhyām | karṇābhyām | chubukāt | adhi || yakṣmam | śīrṣaṇyam | mastiṣkāt | jihvāyāḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.1||

IAST: grīvābhyas ta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt
Griffith: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spi
Devanāgarī: ग्रीवाभ्यस्त उष्णिहाभ्यः कीकसाभ्यो अनूक्यात्
pada pāṭha: grīvābhyaḥ | te | uṣṇihābhyaḥ | kīkasābhyaḥ | anūkyāt || yakṣmam | doṣaṇyam | aṁsābhyām | bāhu-bhyām | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.2||

IAST: yakṣmaṁ doṣaṇyam aṁsābhyām bāhubhyāṁ vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं दोषण्यमंसाभ्यां बाहुभ्यां वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: grīvābhyaḥ | te | uṣṇihābhyaḥ | kīkasābhyaḥ | anūkyāt || yakṣmam | doṣaṇyam | aṁsābhyām | bāhu-bhyām | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.2||

IAST: āntrebhyas te gudābhyo vaniṣṭhor hṛdayād adhi
Griffith: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart,
Devanāgarī: आन्त्रेभ्यस्ते गुदाभ्यो वनिष्ठोर्हृदयादधि
pada pāṭha: āntrebhyaḥ | te | gudābhyaḥ | vaniṣṭhoḥ | hr̥dayāt | adhi || yakṣmam | matasnābhyām | yaknaḥ | plāśi-bhyaḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.3||

IAST: yakṣmam matasnābhyāṁ yaknaḥ plāśibhyo vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: From kidneys, liver, and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं मतस्नाभ्यां यक्नः प्लाशिभ्यो वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: āntrebhyaḥ | te | gudābhyaḥ | vaniṣṭhoḥ | hr̥dayāt | adhi || yakṣmam | matasnābhyām | yaknaḥ | plāśi-bhyaḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.3||

IAST: ūrubhyāṁ te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām
Griffith: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the
Devanāgarī: ऊरुभ्यां ते अष्ठीवद्भ्यां पार्ष्णिभ्यां प्रपदाभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: ūru-bhyām | te | aṣṭhīvat-bhyām | pārṣṇi-bhyām | pra-padābhyām || yakṣmam | śroṇi-bhyām | bhāsadāt | bhaṁsasaḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.4||

IAST: yakṣmaṁ śroṇibhyām bhāsadād bhaṁsaso vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: From hips from stomach, and from groin I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं श्रोणिभ्यां भासदाद्भंससो वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: ūru-bhyām | te | aṣṭhīvat-bhyām | pārṣṇi-bhyām | pra-padābhyām || yakṣmam | śroṇi-bhyām | bhāsadāt | bhaṁsasaḥ | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.4||

IAST: mehanād vanaṁkaraṇāl lomabhyas te nakhebhyaḥ
Griffith: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from they nails,
Devanāgarī: मेहनाद्वनंकरणाल्लोमभ्यस्ते नखेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: mehanāt | vanam-karaṇāt | loma-bhyaḥ | te | nakhebhyaḥ || yakṣmam | sarvasmāt | ātmanaḥ | tam | idam | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.5||

IAST: yakṣmaṁ sarvasmād ātmanas tam idaṁ vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: From all thyself from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं सर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: mehanāt | vanam-karaṇāt | loma-bhyaḥ | te | nakhebhyaḥ || yakṣmam | sarvasmāt | ātmanaḥ | tam | idam | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.5||

IAST: aṅgād-aṅgāl lomno-lomno jātam parvaṇi-parvaṇi
Griffith: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint,
Devanāgarī: अङ्गादङ्गाल्लोम्नोलोम्नो जातं पर्वणिपर्वणि
pada pāṭha: aṅgāt-aṅgāt | lomnaḥ-lomnaḥ | jātam | parvaṇi-parvaṇi || yakṣmam | sarvasmāt | ātmanaḥ | tam | idam | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.6||

IAST: yakṣmaṁ sarvasmād ātmanas tam idaṁ vi vṛhāmi te
Griffith: From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.
Devanāgarī: यक्ष्मं सर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वृहामि ते
pada pāṭha: aṅgāt-aṅgāt | lomnaḥ-lomnaḥ | jātam | parvaṇi-parvaṇi || yakṣmam | sarvasmāt | ātmanaḥ | tam | idam | vi | vr̥hāmi | te ||10.163.6||

IAST: apehi manasas pate 'pa krāma paraś cara
Griffith: AVAUNT, thou Master of the mind Depart, and vanish far away.
Devanāgarī: अपेहि मनसस्पतेऽप क्राम परश्चर
pada pāṭha: apa | ihi | manasaḥ | pate | apa | krāma | paraḥ | cara || paraḥ | niḥ-r̥tyai | ā | cakṣva | bahudhā | jīvataḥ | manaḥ ||10.164.1||

IAST: paro nirṛtyā ā cakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ
Griffith: Look on Destruction far from hence. The live man's mind is manifold.
Devanāgarī: परो निरृत्या आ चक्ष्व बहुधा जीवतो मनः
pada pāṭha: apa | ihi | manasaḥ | pate | apa | krāma | paraḥ | cara || paraḥ | niḥ-r̥tyai | ā | cakṣva | bahudhā | jīvataḥ | manaḥ ||10.164.1||

IAST: bhadraṁ vai varaṁ vṛṇate bhadraṁ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam
Griffith: A happy boon do men elect, a mighty blessing they obtain.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं वै वरं वृणते भद्रं युञ्जन्ति दक्षिणम्
pada pāṭha: bhadram | vai | varam | vr̥ṇate | bhadram | yuñjanti | dakṣiṇam || bhadram | vaivasvate | cakṣuḥ | bahu-trā | jīvataḥ | manaḥ ||10.164.2||

IAST: bhadraṁ vaivasvate cakṣur bahutrā jīvato manaḥ
Griffith: Bliss with Vaivasvata they see. The live man's mind seeks many a place.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं वैवस्वते चक्षुर्बहुत्रा जीवतो मनः
pada pāṭha: bhadram | vai | varam | vr̥ṇate | bhadram | yuñjanti | dakṣiṇam || bhadram | vaivasvate | cakṣuḥ | bahu-trā | jīvataḥ | manaḥ ||10.164.2||

IAST: yad āśasā niḥśasābhiśasopārima jāgrato yat svapantaḥ

IAST: indra iveha dhruvas tiṣṭheha rāṣṭram u dhāraya
Griffith: Stand stedfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the gras
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र इवेह ध्रुवस्तिष्ठेह राष्ट्रमु धारय
pada pāṭha: iha | eva | edhi | mā | apa | cyoṣṭhāḥ | parvataḥ-iva | avi-cācaliḥ || indra-iva | iha | dhruvaḥ | tiṣṭha | iha | rāṣṭram | ūm̐ iti | dhāraya ||10.173.2||

IAST: imam indro adīdharad dhruvaṁ dhruveṇa haviṣā
Griffith: This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by strong oblation's power.
Devanāgarī: इममिन्द्रो अदीधरद्ध्रुवं ध्रुवेण हविषा
pada pāṭha: imam | indraḥ | adīdharat | dhruvam | dhruveṇa | haviṣā || tasmai | somaḥ | adhi | bravat | tasmai | ūm̐ iti | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||10.173.3||

IAST: tasmai somo adhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: May Soma speak a benison, and Brahmanaspati, on him.
Devanāgarī: तस्मै सोमो अधि ब्रवत्तस्मा उ ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: imam | indraḥ | adīdharat | dhruvam | dhruveṇa | haviṣā || tasmai | somaḥ | adhi | bravat | tasmai | ūm̐ iti | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||10.173.3||

IAST: dhruvā dyaur dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime
Griffith: Firm is the sky and firm the earth, and stedfast also are these hills.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवा द्यौर्ध्रुवा पृथिवी ध्रुवासः पर्वता इमे
pada pāṭha: dhruvā | dyauḥ | dhruvā | pr̥thivī | dhruvāsaḥ | parvatāḥ | ime || dhruvam | viśvam | idam | jagat | dhruvaḥ | rājā | viśām | ayam ||10.173.4||

IAST: dhruvaṁ viśvam idaṁ jagad dhruvo rājā viśām ayam
Griffith: Stedfast is all this living world, and stedfast is this King of men.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवं विश्वमिदं जगद्ध्रुवो राजा विशामयम्
pada pāṭha: dhruvā | dyauḥ | dhruvā | pr̥thivī | dhruvāsaḥ | parvatāḥ | ime || dhruvam | viśvam | idam | jagat | dhruvaḥ | rājā | viśām | ayam ||10.173.4||

IAST: dhruvaṁ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṁ devo bṛhaspatiḥ
Griffith: Stedfast, may Varuna the King, stedfast, the God Brhaspati,
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवं ते राजा वरुणो ध्रुवं देवो बृहस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | te | rājā | varuṇaḥ | dhruvam | devaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ || dhruvam | te | indraḥ | ca | agniḥ | ca | rāṣṭram | dhārayatām | dhruvam ||10.173.5||

IAST: dhruvaṁ ta indraś cāgniś ca rāṣṭraṁ dhārayatāṁ dhruvam
Griffith: Stedfast, may Indra, stedfast too, may Agni keep thy stedfast reign.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवं त इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च राष्ट्रं धारयतां ध्रुवम्
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | te | rājā | varuṇaḥ | dhruvam | devaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ || dhruvam | te | indraḥ | ca | agniḥ | ca | rāṣṭram | dhārayatām | dhruvam ||10.173.5||

IAST: dhruvaṁ dhruveṇa haviṣābhi somam mṛśāmasi
Griffith: On constant Soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवं ध्रुवेण हविषाभि सोमं मृशामसि
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | dhruveṇa | haviṣā | abhi | somam | mr̥śāmasi || atho iti | te | indraḥ | kevalīḥ | viśaḥ | bali-hr̥taḥ | karat ||10.173.6||

IAST: atho ta indraḥ kevalīr viśo balihṛtas karat
Griffith: And then may Indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone.
Devanāgarī: अथो त इन्द्रः केवलीर्विशो बलिहृतस्करत्
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | dhruveṇa | haviṣā | abhi | somam | mr̥śāmasi || atho iti | te | indraḥ | kevalīḥ | viśaḥ | bali-hr̥taḥ | karat ||10.173.6||

IAST: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte
Griffith: WITH offering for success in fight whence Indra was victorious.
Devanāgarī: अभीवर्तेन हविषा येनेन्द्रो अभिवावृते
pada pāṭha: abhi-vartena | haviṣā | yena | indraḥ | abhi-vavr̥te || tena | asmān | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | abhi | rāṣṭrāya | vartaya ||10.174.1||

IAST: tenāsmān brahmaṇas pate 'bhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya
Griffith: With this, O Brahmanaspati, let us attain to royal sway.
Devanāgarī: तेनास्मान्ब्रह्मणस्पतेऽभि राष्ट्राय वर्तय
pada pāṭha: abhi-vartena | haviṣā | yena | indraḥ | abhi-vavr̥te || tena | asmān | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | abhi | rāṣṭrāya | vartaya ||10.174.1||

IAST: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yā no arātayaḥ
Griffith: Subduing those who rival us, subduing all malignities,
Devanāgarī: अभिवृत्य सपत्नानभि या नो अरातयः
pada pāṭha: abhi-vr̥tya | sa-patnān | abhi | yāḥ | naḥ | arātayaḥ || abhi | pr̥tanyantam | tiṣṭha | abhi | yaḥ | naḥ | irasyati ||10.174.2||

IAST: abhi pṛtanyantaṁ tiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati
Griffith: Withstand the man who menaces, withstand the man who angers us.
Devanāgarī: अभि पृतन्यन्तं तिष्ठाभि यो न इरस्यति
pada pāṭha: abhi-vr̥tya | sa-patnān | abhi | yāḥ | naḥ | arātayaḥ || abhi | pr̥tanyantam | tiṣṭha | abhi | yaḥ | naḥ | irasyati ||10.174.2||

IAST: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat
Griffith: Soma and Savitar the God have made thee a victorious King
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा देवः सविताभि सोमो अवीवृतत्
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | devaḥ | savitā | abhi | somaḥ | avīvr̥tat || abhi | tvā | viśvā | bhūtāni | abhi-vartaḥ | yathā | asasi ||10.174.3||

IAST: abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāny abhīvarto yathāsasi
Griffith: All elements have aided thee, to make thee general conqueror.
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा विश्वा भूतान्यभीवर्तो यथाससि
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | devaḥ | savitā | abhi | somaḥ | avīvr̥tat || abhi | tvā | viśvā | bhūtāni | abhi-vartaḥ | yathā | asasi ||10.174.3||

IAST: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvy abhavad dyumny uttamaḥ
Griffith: Oblation, that which Indra. gave and thus grew glorious and most high,-
Devanāgarī: येनेन्द्रो हविषा कृत्व्यभवद्द्युम्न्युत्तमः
pada pāṭha: yena | indraḥ | haviṣā | kr̥tvī | abhavat | dyumnī | ut-tamaḥ || idam | tat | akri | devāḥ | asapatnaḥ | kila | abhuvam ||10.174.4||

IAST: idaṁ tad akri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam
Griffith: This have I offered, Gods! and hence now, verily, am rivalless.
Devanāgarī: इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्नः किलाभुवम्
pada pāṭha: yena | indraḥ | haviṣā | kr̥tvī | abhavat | dyumnī | ut-tamaḥ || idam | tat | akri | devāḥ | asapatnaḥ | kila | abhuvam ||10.174.4||

IAST: asapatnaḥ sapatnahābhirāṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ
Griffith: Slayer of rivals, rivalless, victorious, with royal sway,
Devanāgarī: असपत्नः सपत्नहाभिराष्ट्रो विषासहिः
pada pāṭha: asapatnaḥ | sapatna-hā | abhi-rāṣṭraḥ | vi-sasahiḥ || yathā | aham | eṣām | bhūtānām | vi-rājāni | janasya | ca ||10.174.5||

IAST: yathāham eṣām bhūtānāṁ virājāni janasya ca
Griffith: Over these beings may I rule, may I be Sovran of the folk.
Devanāgarī: यथाहमेषां भूतानां विराजानि जनस्य च
pada pāṭha: asapatnaḥ | sapatna-hā | abhi-rāṣṭraḥ | vi-sasahiḥ || yathā | aham | eṣām | bhūtānām | vi-rājāni | janasya | ca ||10.174.5||

IAST: pra vo grāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
Griffith: I. MAY Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you according to the Law:
Devanāgarī: प्र वो ग्रावाणः सविता देवः सुवतु धर्मणा
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | savitā | devaḥ | suvatu | dharmaṇā || dhūḥ-su | yujyadhvam | sunuta ||10.175.1||

IAST: dhūrṣu yujyadhvaṁ sunuta
Griffith: Be harnessed to the shafts, and press.
Devanāgarī: धूर्षु युज्यध्वं सुनुत
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | savitā | devaḥ | suvatu | dharmaṇā || dhūḥ-su | yujyadhvam | sunuta ||10.175.1||

IAST: grāvāṇo apa ducchunām apa sedhata durmatim
Griffith: Stones, drive calamity away, drive ye away malevolence:
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाणो अप दुच्छुनामप सेधत दुर्मतिम्
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | apa | ducchunām | apa | sedhata | duḥ-matim || usrāḥ | kartana | bheṣajam ||10.175.2||

IAST: usrāḥ kartana bheṣajam
Griffith: Make ye the Cows our medicine.
Devanāgarī: उस्राः कर्तन भेषजम्
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | apa | ducchunām | apa | sedhata | duḥ-matim || usrāḥ | kartana | bheṣajam ||10.175.2||

IAST: grāvāṇa upareṣv ā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Of one accord the upper Stones, giving the Bull his bull-like strength,
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाण उपरेष्वा महीयन्ते सजोषसः
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | upareṣu | ā | mahīyante | sa-joṣasaḥ || vr̥ṣṇe | dadhataḥ | vr̥ṣṇyam ||10.175.3||

IAST: vṛṣṇe dadhato vṛṣṇyam
Griffith: Look down with pride on those below.
Devanāgarī: वृष्णे दधतो वृष्ण्यम्
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | upareṣu | ā | mahīyante | sa-joṣasaḥ || vr̥ṣṇe | dadhataḥ | vr̥ṣṇyam ||10.175.3||

IAST: grāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
Griffith: May Savitar the God, O Stones, stir you as Law commands for him
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाणः सविता नु वो देवः सुवतु धर्मणा
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | savitā | nu | vaḥ | devaḥ | suvatu | dharmaṇā || yajamānāya | sunvate ||10.175.4||

IAST: yajamānāya sunvate
Griffith: Who sacrifices, pouring juice.
Devanāgarī: यजमानाय सुन्वते
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | savitā | nu | vaḥ | devaḥ | suvatu | dharmaṇā || yajamānāya | sunvate ||10.175.4||

IAST: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇām bṛhan navanta vṛjanā
Griffith: WITH hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the Rbhus' mighty deeds.
Devanāgarī: प्र सूनव ऋभूणां बृहन्नवन्त वृजना
pada pāṭha: pra | sūnavaḥ | r̥bhūṇām | br̥hat | navanta | vr̥janā || kṣāma | ye | viśva-dhāyasaḥ | aśnan | dhenum | na | mātaram ||10.176.1||

IAST: kṣāmā ye viśvadhāyaso 'śnan dhenuṁ na mātaram
Griffith: Who, all-supporting, have enjoyed the earth as, twere a mother cow.
Devanāgarī: क्षामा ये विश्वधायसोऽश्नन्धेनुं न मातरम्
pada pāṭha: pra | sūnavaḥ | r̥bhūṇām | br̥hat | navanta | vr̥janā || kṣāma | ye | viśva-dhāyasaḥ | aśnan | dhenum | na | mātaram ||10.176.1||

IAST: pra devaṁ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam
Griffith: Bring forth the God with song divine, being Jatavedas hitherward,
Devanāgarī: प्र देवं देव्या धिया भरता जातवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: pra | devam | devyā | dhiyā | bharata | jāta-vedasam || havyā | naḥ | vakṣat | ānuṣak ||10.176.2||

IAST: havyā no vakṣad ānuṣak
Griffith: To bear our gifts at once to heaven.
Devanāgarī: हव्या नो वक्षदानुषक्
pada pāṭha: pra | devam | devyā | dhiyā | bharata | jāta-vedasam || havyā | naḥ | vakṣat | ānuṣak ||10.176.2||

IAST: ayam u ṣya pra devayur hotā yajñāya nīyate
Griffith: He here, a God-devoted Priest, led forward comes to sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: अयमु ष्य प्र देवयुर्होता यज्ञाय नीयते
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | pra | deva-yuḥ | hotā | yajñāya | nīyate || rathaḥ | na | yoḥ | abhi-vr̥taḥ | ghr̥ṇi-vān | cetati | tmanā ||10.176.3||

IAST: ratho na yor abhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñ cetati tmanā
Griffith: Like a car covered for the road, he, glowing, knows, himself, the way.
Devanāgarī: रथो न योरभीवृतो घृणीवाञ्चेतति त्मना
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | pra | deva-yuḥ | hotā | yajñāya | nīyate || rathaḥ | na | yoḥ | abhi-vr̥taḥ | ghr̥ṇi-vān | cetati | tmanā ||10.176.3||

IAST: ayam agnir uruṣyaty amṛtād iva janmanaḥ
Griffith: This Agni rescues from distress, as 'twere from the Immortal Race,
Devanāgarī: अयमग्निरुरुष्यत्यमृतादिव जन्मनः
pada pāṭha: ayam | agniḥ | uruṣyati | amr̥tāt-iva | janmanaḥ || sahasaḥ | cit | sahīyān | devaḥ | jīvātave | kr̥taḥ ||10.176.4||

IAST: sahasaś cit sahīyān devo jīvātave kṛtaḥ
Griffith: A God yet mightier than strength, a God who hath been made for life.
Devanāgarī: सहसश्चित्सहीयान्देवो जीवातवे कृतः
pada pāṭha: ayam | agniḥ | uruṣyati | amr̥tāt-iva | janmanaḥ || sahasaḥ | cit | sahīyān | devaḥ | jīvātave | kr̥taḥ ||10.176.4||

IAST: pataṁgam aktam asurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasā vipaścitaḥ
Griffith: THE sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the Bird adorned with
Devanāgarī: पतंगमक्तमसुरस्य मायया हृदा पश्यन्ति मनसा विपश्चितः
pada pāṭha: pataṅgam | aktam | asurasya | māyayā | hr̥dā | paśyanti | manasā | vipaḥ-citaḥ || samudre | antariti | kavayaḥ | vi | cakṣate | marīcīnām | padam | icchanti | vedhasaḥ ||10.177.1||

IAST: samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnām padam icchanti vedhasaḥ
Griffith: Sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth: the wise disposers seek t
Devanāgarī: समुद्रे अन्तः कवयो वि चक्षते मरीचीनां पदमिच्छन्ति वेधसः
pada pāṭha: pataṅgam | aktam | asurasya | māyayā | hr̥dā | paśyanti | manasā | vipaḥ-citaḥ || samudre | antariti | kavayaḥ | vi | cakṣate | marīcīnām | padam | icchanti | vedhasaḥ ||10.177.1||

IAST: pataṁgo vācam manasā bibharti tāṁ gandharvo 'vadad garbhe antaḥ
Griffith: The flying Bird bears Speech within his spirit: erst the Gandharva in the
Devanāgarī: पतंगो वाचं मनसा बिभर्ति तां गन्धर्वोऽवदद्गर्भे अन्तः
pada pāṭha: pataṅgaḥ | vācam | manasā | bibharti | tām | gandharvaḥ | avadat | garbhe | antariti || tām | dyotamānām | svaryam | manīṣām | r̥tasya | pade | kavayaḥ | ni | pānti ||10.177.2||

IAST: tāṁ dyotamānāṁ svaryam manīṣām ṛtasya pade kavayo ni pānti
Griffith: And at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant, heavenly-br
Devanāgarī: तां द्योतमानां स्वर्यं मनीषामृतस्य पदे कवयो नि पान्ति
pada pāṭha: pataṅgaḥ | vācam | manasā | bibharti | tām | gandharvaḥ | avadat | garbhe | antariti || tām | dyotamānām | svaryam | manīṣām | r̥tasya | pade | kavayaḥ | ni | pānti ||10.177.2||

IAST: apaśyaṁ gopām anipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiś carantam
Griffith: I saw the Herdsman, him who never resteth, approaching and departing on hi
Devanāgarī: अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम्
pada pāṭha: apaśyam | gopām | ani-padyamānam | ā | ca | parā | ca | pathi-bhiḥ | carantam || saḥ | sadhrīcīḥ | saḥ | viṣūcīḥ | vasānaḥ | ā | varīvarti | bhuvaneṣu | antariti ||10.177.3||

IAST: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīr vasāna ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣv antaḥ
Griffith: He, clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds conti
Devanāgarī: स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्ति भुवनेष्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: apaśyam | gopām | ani-padyamānam | ā | ca | parā | ca | pathi-bhiḥ | carantam || saḥ | sadhrīcīḥ | saḥ | viṣūcīḥ | vasānaḥ | ā | varīvarti | bhuvaneṣu | antariti ||10.177.3||

IAST: tyam ū ṣu vājinaṁ devajūtaṁ sahāvānaṁ tarutāraṁ rathānām
Griffith: THIS very mighty one whom Gods commission, the Conqueror of cars, ever tri
Devanāgarī: त्यमू षु वाजिनं देवजूतं सहावानं तरुतारं रथानाम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | ūm̐ iti | su | vājinam | deva-jūtam | saha-vānam | taru-tāram | rathānām || ariṣṭa-nemim | pr̥tanājam | āśum | svastaye | tārkṣyam | iha | huvema ||10.178.1||

IAST: ariṣṭanemim pṛtanājam āśuṁ svastaye tārkṣyam ihā huvema
Griffith: Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Tarksya for our wea
Devanāgarī: अरिष्टनेमिं पृतनाजमाशुं स्वस्तये तार्क्ष्यमिहा हुवेम
pada pāṭha: tyam | ūm̐ iti | su | vājinam | deva-jūtam | saha-vānam | taru-tāram | rathānām || ariṣṭa-nemim | pr̥tanājam | āśum | svastaye | tārkṣyam | iha | huvema ||10.178.1||

IAST: indrasyeva rātim ājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvam ivā ruhema
Griffith: As though we offered up our gifts to Indra, may we ascend. him as a ship.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्येव रातिमाजोहुवानाः स्वस्तये नावमिवा रुहेम

Griffith: MAY Visnu form and mould the womb, may Tvastar duly shape the forms,

pada pāṭha: viṣṇuḥ | yonim | kalpayatu | tvaṣṭā | rūpāṇi | piṁśatu || ā | siñcatu | prajā-patiḥ | dhātā | garbham | dadhātu | te ||10.184.1||

IAST: ā siñcatu prajāpatir dhātā garbhaṁ dadhātu te
Griffith: Prajapati infuse the stream, and Dhatar lay the germ for thee.
Devanāgarī: आ सिञ्चतु प्रजापतिर्धाता गर्भं दधातु ते
pada pāṭha: viṣṇuḥ | yonim | kalpayatu | tvaṣṭā | rūpāṇi | piṁśatu || ā | siñcatu | prajā-patiḥ | dhātā | garbham | dadhātu | te ||10.184.1||

IAST: garbhaṁ dhehi sinīvāli garbhaṁ dhehi sarasvati
Griffith: O Sinivali, set the germ, set thou the germ, Sarasvati:
Devanāgarī: गर्भं धेहि सिनीवालि गर्भं धेहि सरस्वति
pada pāṭha: garbham | dhehi | sinīvāli | garbham | dhehi | sarasvati || garbham | te | aśvinau | devau | ā | dhattām | puṣkara-srajā ||10.184.2||

IAST: garbhaṁ te aśvinau devāv ā dhattām puṣkarasrajā
Griffith: May the Twain Gods bestow the germ, the Asvins crowned with lotuses.
Devanāgarī: गर्भं ते अश्विनौ देवावा धत्तां पुष्करस्रजा
pada pāṭha: garbham | dhehi | sinīvāli | garbham | dhehi | sarasvati || garbham | te | aśvinau | devau | ā | dhattām | puṣkara-srajā ||10.184.2||

IAST: hiraṇyayī araṇī yaṁ nirmanthato aśvinā
Griffith: That which the Asvins Twain rub forth with the attrition-sticks of gold,-
Devanāgarī: हिरण्ययी अरणी यं निर्मन्थतो अश्विना
pada pāṭha: hiraṇyayī iti | araṇī iti | yam | niḥ-manthataḥ | aśvinā || tam | te | garbham | havāmahe | daśame | māsi | sūtave ||10.184.3||

IAST: taṁ te garbhaṁ havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave
Griffith: That germ of thine we invocate, that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.
Devanāgarī: तं ते गर्भं हवामहे दशमे मासि सूतवे
pada pāṭha: hiraṇyayī iti | araṇī iti | yam | niḥ-manthataḥ | aśvinā || tam | te | garbham | havāmahe | daśame | māsi | sūtave ||10.184.3||

IAST: mahi trīṇām avo 'stu dyukṣam mitrasyāryamṇaḥ
Griffith: GREAT, unassailable must he the heavenly favour of' Three Gods,
Devanāgarī: महि त्रीणामवोऽस्तु द्युक्षं मित्रस्यार्यम्णः
pada pāṭha: mahi | trīṇām | avaḥ | astu | dyukṣam | mitrasya | aryamṇaḥ || duḥ-ādharṣam | varuṇasya ||10.185.1||

IAST: durādharṣaṁ varuṇasya
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman.
Devanāgarī: दुराधर्षं वरुणस्य
pada pāṭha: mahi | trīṇām | avaḥ | astu | dyukṣam | mitrasya | aryamṇaḥ || duḥ-ādharṣam | varuṇasya ||10.185.1||

IAST: nahi teṣām amā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu
Griffith: O'er these, neither at home nor yet abroad or pathways that are Strange,
Devanāgarī: नहि तेषाममा चन नाध्वसु वारणेषु
pada pāṭha: nahi | teṣām | amā | cana | na | adhva-su | vāraṇeṣu || īśe | ripuḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ ||10.185.2||

IAST: īśe ripur aghaśaṁsaḥ
Griffith: The evil-minded foe hath power
Devanāgarī: ईशे रिपुरघशंसः
pada pāṭha: nahi | teṣām | amā | cana | na | adhva-su | vāraṇeṣu || īśe | ripuḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ ||10.185.2||

IAST: yasmai putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya
Griffith: Nor over him,
Devanāgarī: यस्मै पुत्रासो अदितेः प्र जीवसे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: yasmai | putrāsaḥ | aditeḥ | pra | jīvase | martyāya || jyotiḥ | yacchanti | ajasram ||10.185.3||

IAST: jyotir yacchanty ajasram
Griffith: the man on whom the Sons of Aditi bestow Eternal light that he may live.
Devanāgarī: ज्योतिर्यच्छन्त्यजस्रम्
pada pāṭha: yasmai | putrāsaḥ | aditeḥ | pra | jīvase | martyāya || jyotiḥ | yacchanti | ajasram ||10.185.3||

IAST: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṁ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde
Griffith: FILLING our hearts with health and joy, may Vata breathe his balm on us
Devanāgarī: वात आ वातु भेषजं शम्भु मयोभु नो हृदे
pada pāṭha: vātaḥ | ā | vātu | bheṣajam | śam-bhu | mayaḥ-bhu | naḥ | hr̥de || pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tāriṣat ||10.186.1||

IAST: pra ṇa āyūṁṣi tāriṣat
Griffith: May he prolong our days of life.
Devanāgarī: प्र ण आयूंषि तारिषत्
pada pāṭha: vātaḥ | ā | vātu | bheṣajam | śam-bhu | mayaḥ-bhu | naḥ | hr̥de || pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tāriṣat ||10.186.1||

IAST: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā
Griffith: Thou art our Father, Vata, yea, thou art a Brother and a friend,
Devanāgarī: उत वात पितासि न उत भ्रातोत नः सखा
pada pāṭha: uta | vāta | pitā | asi | naḥ | uta | bhrātā | uta | naḥ | sakhā || saḥ | naḥ | jīvātave | kr̥dhi ||10.186.2||

IAST: sa no jīvātave kṛdhi
Griffith: So give us strength that we may live.
Devanāgarī: स नो जीवातवे कृधि
pada pāṭha: uta | vāta | pitā | asi | naḥ | uta | bhrātā | uta | naḥ | sakhā || saḥ | naḥ | jīvātave | kr̥dhi ||10.186.2||

IAST: yad ado vāta te gṛhe 'mṛtasya nidhir hitaḥ
Griffith: The store of Amrta laid away yonder, O Vata, in thine home,-
Devanāgarī: यददो वात ते गृहेऽमृतस्य निधिर्हितः
pada pāṭha: yat | adaḥ | vāta | te | gr̥he | amr̥tasya | ni-dhiḥ | hitaḥ || tataḥ | naḥ | dehi | jīvase ||10.186.3||

IAST: tato no dehi jīvase
Griffith: Give us thereof that we may live.
Devanāgarī: ततो नो देहि जीवसे
pada pāṭha: yat | adaḥ | vāta | te | gr̥he | amr̥tasya | ni-dhiḥ | hitaḥ || tataḥ | naḥ | dehi | jīvase ||10.186.3||

IAST: prāgnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
Griffith: To Agni send I forth my song, to him the Bull of all the folk:
Devanāgarī: प्राग्नये वाचमीरय वृषभाय क्षितीनाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | vācam | īraya | vr̥ṣabhāya | kṣitīnām || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.1||

IAST: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: So may he bear us past our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नः पर्षदति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | vācam | īraya | vr̥ṣabhāya | kṣitīnām || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.1||

IAST: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatas tiro dhanvātirocate
Griffith: Who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes:
Devanāgarī: यः परस्याः परावतस्तिरो धन्वातिरोचते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | parasyāḥ | parā-vataḥ | tiraḥ | dhanva | ati-rocate || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.2||

IAST: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: So may he bear us past our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नः पर्षदति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | parasyāḥ | parā-vataḥ | tiraḥ | dhanva | ati-rocate || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.2||

IAST: yo rakṣāṁsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā
Griffith: The Bull with brightly-gleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends
Devanāgarī: यो रक्षांसि निजूर्वति वृषा शुक्रेण शोचिषा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rakṣāṁsi | ni-jūrvati | vr̥ṣā | śukreṇa | śociṣā || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.3||

IAST: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: So may he bear us past our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नः पर्षदति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rakṣāṁsi | ni-jūrvati | vr̥ṣā | śukreṇa | śociṣā || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.3||

IAST: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṁ ca paśyati
Griffith: Who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view:
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvā | abhi | vi-paśyati | bhuvanā | sam | ca | paśyati || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.4||

IAST: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: So may he bear us past our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नः पर्षदति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvā | abhi | vi-paśyati | bhuvanā | sam | ca | paśyati || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.4||

IAST: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro agnir ajāyata
Griffith: Resplendent Agni, who was born in farthest region of the air:
Devanāgarī: यो अस्य पारे रजसः शुक्रो अग्निरजायत
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asya | pāre | rajasaḥ | śukraḥ | agniḥ | ajāyata || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.5||

IAST: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: So may he bear us past our foes.
Devanāgarī: स नः पर्षदति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asya | pāre | rajasaḥ | śukraḥ | agniḥ | ajāyata || saḥ | naḥ | parṣat | ati | dviṣaḥ ||10.187.5||

IAST: pra nūnaṁ jātavedasam aśvaṁ hinota vājinam
Griffith: Now send ye Jatavedas forth, send hitherward the vigorous Steed
Devanāgarī: प्र नूनं जातवेदसमश्वं हिनोत वाजिनम्
pada pāṭha: pra | nūnam | jāta-vedasam | aśvam | hinota | vājinam || idam | naḥ | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||10.188.1||

IAST: idaṁ no barhir āsade
Griffith: To seat him on our sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: इदं नो बर्हिरासदे
pada pāṭha: pra | nūnam | jāta-vedasam | aśvam | hinota | vājinam || idam | naḥ | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||10.188.1||

IAST: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḻhuṣaḥ
Griffith: I raise the lofty eulogy of Jatavedas, raining boons,
Devanāgarī: अस्य प्र जातवेदसो विप्रवीरस्य मीळ्हुषः
pada pāṭha: asya | pra | jāta-vedasaḥ | vipra-vīrasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ || mahīm | iyarmi | su-stutim ||10.188.2||

IAST: mahīm iyarmi suṣṭutim
Griffith: With sages for his hero band.
Devanāgarī: महीमियर्मि सुष्टुतिम्
pada pāṭha: asya | pra | jāta-vedasaḥ | vipra-vīrasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ || mahīm | iyarmi | su-stutim ||10.188.2||

IAST: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ
Griffith: With flames of Jatavedas which carry oblation to the Gods,
Devanāgarī: या रुचो जातवेदसो देवत्रा हव्यवाहनीः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | rucaḥ | jāta-vedasaḥ | deva-trā | havya-vāhanīḥ || tābhiḥ | naḥ | yajñam | invatu ||10.188.3||

IAST: tābhir no yajñam invatu
Griffith: May he promote our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्नो यज्ञमिन्वतु
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | rucaḥ | jāta-vedasaḥ | deva-trā | havya-vāhanīḥ || tābhiḥ | naḥ | yajñam | invatu ||10.188.3||

IAST: āyaṁ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaram puraḥ
Griffith: THIS spotted Bull hath come, and sat before the Mother in the east,
Devanāgarī: आयं गौः पृश्निरक्रमीदसदन्मातरं पुरः
pada pāṭha: ā | ayam | gauḥ | pr̥śniḥ | akramīt | asadat | mātaram | puraḥ || pitaram | ca | pra-yan | svariti svaḥ ||10.189.1||

IAST: pitaraṁ ca prayan svaḥ
Griffith: Advancing to his Father heaven.
Devanāgarī: पितरं च प्रयन्स्वः
pada pāṭha: ā | ayam | gauḥ | pr̥śniḥ | akramīt | asadat | mātaram | puraḥ || pitaram | ca | pra-yan | svariti svaḥ ||10.189.1||

IAST: antaś carati rocanāsya prāṇād apānatī
Griffith: Expiring when he draws his breath, she moves along the lucid spheres:
Devanāgarī: अन्तश्चरति रोचनास्य प्राणादपानती
pada pāṭha: antariti | carati | rocanā | asya | prāṇāt | apa-anatī || vi | akhyat | mahiṣaḥ | divam ||10.189.2||

IAST: vy akhyan mahiṣo divam
Griffith: The Bull shines out through all the sky.
Devanāgarī: व्यख्यन्महिषो दिवम्
pada pāṭha: antariti | carati | rocanā | asya | prāṇāt | apa-anatī || vi | akhyat | mahiṣaḥ | divam ||10.189.2||

IAST: triṁśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṁgāya dhīyate
Griffith: Song is bestowed upon the Bird: it rules supreme through thirty realms
Devanāgarī: त्रिंशद्धाम वि राजति वाक्पतंगाय धीयते
pada pāṭha: triṁśat | dhāma | vi | rājati | vāk | pataṅgāya | dhīyate || prati | vastoḥ | aha | dyu-bhiḥ ||10.189.3||

IAST: prati vastor aha dyubhiḥ
Griffith: Throughout the days at break of morn.
Devanāgarī: प्रति वस्तोरह द्युभिः
pada pāṭha: triṁśat | dhāma | vi | rājati | vāk | pataṅgāya | dhīyate || prati | vastoḥ | aha | dyu-bhiḥ ||10.189.3||

IAST: ṛtaṁ ca satyaṁ cābhīddhāt tapaso 'dhy ajāyata
Griffith: FROM Fervour kindled to its height Eternal Law and Truth were born:
Devanāgarī: ऋतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात्तपसोऽध्यजायत
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | ca | satyam | ca | abhi-iddhāt | tapasaḥ | adhi | ajāyata || tataḥ | rātrī | ajāyata | tataḥ | samudraḥ | arṇavaḥ ||10.190.1||

IAST: tato rātry ajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ
Griffith: Thence was the Night produced, and thence the billowy flood of sea arose
Devanāgarī: ततो रात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | ca | satyam | ca | abhi-iddhāt | tapasaḥ | adhi | ajāyata || tataḥ | rātrī | ajāyata | tataḥ | samudraḥ | arṇavaḥ ||10.190.1||

IAST: samudrād arṇavād adhi saṁvatsaro ajāyata
Griffith: From that same billowy flood of sea the Year was afterwards produced,
Devanāgarī: समुद्रादर्णवादधि संवत्सरो अजायत
pada pāṭha: samudrāt | arṇavāt | adhi | saṁvatsaraḥ | ajāyata || ahorātrāṇi | vi-dadhat | viśvasya | miṣataḥ | vaśī ||10.190.2||

IAST: ahorātrāṇi vidadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī
Griffith: Ordainer of the days nights, Lord over all who close the eye.
Devanāgarī: अहोरात्राणि विदधद्विश्वस्य मिषतो वशी
pada pāṭha: samudrāt | arṇavāt | adhi | saṁvatsaraḥ | ajāyata || ahorātrāṇi | vi-dadhat | viśvasya | miṣataḥ | vaśī ||10.190.2||

IAST: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayat
Griffith: Dhatar, the great Creator, then formed in due order Sun and Moon.
Devanāgarī: सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धाता यथापूर्वमकल्पयत्
pada pāṭha: sūryācandramasau | dhātā | yathā-pūrvam | akalpayat || divam | ca | pr̥thivīm | ca | antarikṣam | atho iti | svariti svaḥ ||10.190.3||

IAST: divaṁ ca pṛthivīṁ cāntarikṣam atho svaḥ
Griffith: He formed in order Heaven and Earth, the regions of the air, and light.
Devanāgarī: दिवं च पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षमथो स्वः
pada pāṭha: sūryācandramasau | dhātā | yathā-pūrvam | akalpayat || divam | ca | pr̥thivīm | ca | antarikṣam | atho iti | svariti svaḥ ||10.190.3||

IAST: saṁ-sam id yuvase vṛṣann agne viśvāny arya ā
Griffith: THOU, mighty Agni, gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend.
Devanāgarī: संसमिद्युवसे वृषन्नग्ने विश्वान्यर्य आ
pada pāṭha: sam-sam | it | yuvase | vr̥ṣan | agne | viśvāni | aryaḥ | ā || iḷaḥ | pade | sam | idhyase | saḥ | naḥ | vasūni | ā | bhara ||10.191.1||

IAST: iḻas pade sam idhyase sa no vasūny ā bhara
Griffith: Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place
Devanāgarī: इळस्पदे समिध्यसे स नो वसून्या भर
pada pāṭha: sam-sam | it | yuvase | vr̥ṣan | agne | viśvāni | aryaḥ | ā || iḷaḥ | pade | sam | idhyase | saḥ | naḥ | vasūni | ā | bhara ||10.191.1||

IAST: saṁ gacchadhvaṁ saṁ vadadhvaṁ saṁ vo manāṁsi jānatām
Griffith: Assemble, speak together: let your minds be all of one accord,
Devanāgarī: सं गच्छध्वं सं वदध्वं सं वो मनांसि जानताम्
pada pāṭha: sam | gacchadhvam | sam | vadadhvam | sam | vaḥ | manāṁsi | jānatām || devāḥ | bhāgam | yathā | pūrve | sam-jānānāḥ | upa-āsate ||10.191.2||

IAST: devā bhāgaṁ yathā pūrve saṁjānānā upāsate
Griffith: As ancient Gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.
Devanāgarī: देवा भागं यथा पूर्वे संजानाना उपासते
pada pāṭha: sam | gacchadhvam | sam | vadadhvam | sam | vaḥ | manāṁsi | jānatām || devāḥ | bhāgam | yathā | pūrve | sam-jānānāḥ | upa-āsate ||10.191.2||

IAST: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam manaḥ saha cittam eṣām
